Madame A. Sodjidi est née en 1977 à Gbavé. Aujourd’hui mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle vit auprès de son mari dans le village de Momé Balimé. Très brave, elle exerce le commerce de noix de palmistes. Elle achète généralement des noix non concassées qu’elle fait concasser avant de revendre aux acheteurs qui font l'extraction de l'huile palmiste.
Cependant, le manque de moyens financiers reste son problème le plus récurrent. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit qu’elle souhaite utiliser pour augmenter ses achats et son chiffres d'affaires. Ceci lui permettra de disposer d’un fonds de roulement afin de dégager un revenu beaucoup plus consistant.
texts.en:
Ms. Sodjidi A. was born in 1977 in Gbavé. Today, she is married and the mother of three and lives with her husband in the village of Momé Balimé. A very courageous woman, she is in the palm nut business. Generally, she buys whole nuts that she shells before reselling to buyers, who extract the palm oil. Yet the lack of financial means remains the most recurring problem she has. And so, she is requesting a loan that she would like to use to increase her purchases and her sales figures. This will enable her to have working capital for making a lot of significant income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in palm nuts

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Né en 1971 à Tabligbo, Monsieur N. Komi vit aujourd’hui avec sa famille à Momé-Woédjépé. Enseignant, il est père de cinq (05) enfants. Avec les difficultés de faire vivre décemment sa famille avec son maigre salaire, il veut associer une activité parallèle qui lui servira de source de revenu additive.
Ainsi il veut acheter une moto qu’il mettra en circulation comme taxi. Avec ce financement, il compte réaliser ce projet. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Tabligbo, Mr. Komi N. now lives with his family in Momé-Woédjépé. A teacher, he is the father of five. With the difficulties he has making a decent living for his family with his meager salary, he wants to add concurrent work as a source of additional income. To do so, he wants to buy a motor-bike to put to use as a taxi. With this financing, he intends to realize this project, allowing him to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor-bike

loans.name: Jenefa

texts.en:
Jenefa J. is currently in the business of selling beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Jenefa is 38 years old and is married with a husband that is a nurse. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  n 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Construct a house to rent

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married and has one child. She sells jewelry at the central market in Nikolaev City. She has 9,000 UAH invested in this business, and her monthly gross income is 4,500 UAH. The business is located at a very good place where many people come by.

Larisa has been in this business for 4 years. She decided to start this business because she likes to sell jewelry. Larisa has great communication skills that help her in business. She would like to develop her business even more.

Larisa would like to get a loan of 2,000 UAH to increase the assortment of goods. This would help her to make more profits during the holiday season. Larisa says she wants to work hard and use every opportunity to increase her family's well-being.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of jewelry for sale

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. She is 26 years old and lives with her partner and her daughter. Maria Luz runs a small dry goods store from a rented stand in the Nazarenas Market. She works seven days a week from 6 am to 8 pm and brings her baby daughter to work with her. 

Maria Luz is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy sacks of rice, flour and dried pasta. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice, flour, to improve her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced and raises two teenage children herself. She owns a kiosk at the central market and sells children's clothing. During holidays she buys various decorations to sell and increase her sales. Her gross monthly income is 5,000 UAH.

Tatyana has been in this business for 5 years. She started it when her husband left her with two small children. Being a hard-working person, Tatyana was able to develop this business. Her business goal is to buy second kiosk. This would allow her to increase her income.

Tatyana would like to get a seasonal loan of 2,000 UAH to purchase decorations for Christmas and New Year celebrations. She hopes that increased sales would bring her more profit and allow to celebrate the holidays with her children.

loans.use: To purchase decorations for  Christmas and New Year celebrations, to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander owns a small kiosk and sells household supplies at the central city market. He started this business eight years ago. His gross income is 7,000 UAH per month. The goods he sells are in high demand and his business goes well. Alexander is a hard-working person and he would like to develop his business even more. 

Alexander would like to get a loan of 3,000 to increase the inventory. He hopes that this loan will be another small step in his business growth. Alexander's goal is to have stable source of income for his family.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. She is 28 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. Norma bakes traditional Peruvian breads, like “wawa” and “chapla,” as well as sweet breads. She bakes them in a rented oven and sells them from a market stand she rents. 

Norma is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar and flour. The 1000 soles will pay for about nine sacks of flour, or four of five sacks of flour and a few sacks of sugar.  

Norma’s dream for the future is to buy her market stand and to own a home of her own.

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour and sugar

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Palmeras (“palm trees”) Village Bank. She has been working with the bank for one year. 

Gladys is 27 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Gladys sells grains in the Covadonga Market. She works every day of the week from 7 am to 1 pm. She buys her grains wholesale from area farmers, then resells them by the kilo. 

Gladys is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy broad beans ("habas") and corn. Her goal for the future is to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: Buy broad beans and corn to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is a 34-year-old widow and the mother of two children who are in school. Afia lost her husband through a prolonged illness. She operates a clothing shop in New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region, where she lives with her family.  Afia sells clothing such as blouses, skirts, women slippers, and dressing bags to support her family. She started this business two years ago with her own small amount of capital. She operates on a small scale because of a lack of funds. 

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into her business. She will use the loan to purchase good quality stock so she can upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing such as ladies wear, headscarves, and slippers. Afia is a member of a borrowing group called All Nations Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee the repayment of the loans for one another. Afia does not sell on group-meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Annjane

texts.en:
Annjane is a member of the Alianza Village Bank; she has been working with the bank for five years now. 

Annjane is 42 years old and is the single mother of two children. Annjane runs a store selling “caña” (firewater), a type of alcoholic drink. Locals mix pure alcohol with water to drink, and drink caña by itself or mixed with a little water. She rents her store, which is located on a busy street in the city of Ayacucho, and works seven days a week. She sells her products in large drums and sometimes by the liter. 

Annjane has had her business for seven years; before then she worked in Chiclaya, her hometown. She moved to Ayacucho because business opportunities are better in the city. The caña she sells is purchased from old friends in Chiclaya. 

Annjane is requesting a loan of 3500 soles to buy more caña from Chiclaya. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Buy caña (firewater) from Chiclaya

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is 31 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She loves selling foods and other goods. She has been selling bags of maize for four years to support her family. Maize is one of the favorite cereal foods that supplies carbohydrates in the local diet. She takes delivery of the stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. 

With this loan, she wants to buy bulk maize to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Akua is a member of a community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to resell

loans.name: Gema Misere Group

texts.en:
Florence N. is the leader of the Gema Misere loan group in Mityana. She is a farmer who grows matooke, beans, maize and cassava on plantations that she has owned for a very long time. Once the produce is ready for sale, she sells from her home as well as taking it to the market to sell at a favorable price. 

As a result of getting loans for three years now, she has been able to include the keeping of cows and goats at her home with the savings from her previous cycles, as well as develop her home by buying furniture for her home. Her children are in school and generally the standard of living is great! Florence needs a loan to be able to buy produce from other farmers so as to supply her regular customers plus the many extra due to the festival season. She hopes the the profits will help her with school fees come next year.

Other group members have very similar aspirations.

loans.use: Buying more produce for her business.

loans.name: Sossou Mawugnan

texts.fr:
Né en 1956 à Hédomé, Monsieur B. Sossou Mawugnan réside aujourd’hui dans le même village. Instituteur, il est marié et père de dix (10) enfants. C’est avec son salaire qu’il se débrouille pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Conscient de l’insuffisance de ses revenus financiers, il veut les diversifier à travers des activités génératrices de revenus. Ainsi, il a en projet l’achat de taxi moto pour compenser la conjoncture financière. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit afin d’acheter une moto qu’il mettra en circulation.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Hédomé, Mr. Sossou Mawugnan B. resides in the same village. An elementary school teacher, he is married and the father of ten. With his salary, he gets by, providing for his family. Conscious of his insufficient income, he wants to diversify it through income-generating work. For this, he has plans for the purchase of a moto-taxi to make up for the financial situation. And so, he is requesting a loan to buy a motor-bike that he will put into service.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor-bike

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta A. is 28 years old. She is a single woman with one child. Her kid is in school. She lives with her extended family at Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Benedicta is a very skillful and a talented hairdresser. With her eight years of working experience, she has one apprentice who is currently undergoing training. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, hair dryer machines, etc. to serve her customers well. 

She is a member of the community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support to one another to repay the loan. She was in attendance during her group meeting and her photograph in her beautiful black and white top. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc.

loans.name: God Is With Us Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of Abdul K., Ramatu K., Fatmata K., Isatu K., Kadiatu K., Marie S. and Fatmata T.. They call their group "God Is With Us". They have received several loans through SMT. They have re-paid previous loans successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 1,000,000 each. That loan helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for Le 1,200,000 each to add to their businesses.

Abdul (front right) is the leader of this group. Abdul was born in Roketeh, six miles from the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-five years of age, married with two children – one is in nursery school and the other is only an infant. Abdul also cares for two of his deceased elder brother’s children who are attending school. Abdul’s wife is a businesswoman. Abdul sells ready-to-wear clothes.

With this loan of Le 1,200,000, Abdul will buy about forty pairs of jeans and four dozen shirts. He travels to neighboring Guinea to buy the clothes, paying a round/trip fare of Le 60,000. In Guinea, a pair of trousers costs Le 25,000.  He sells each pair in Sierra Leone for Le 30,000.  

The only challenge Abdul is facing is that of bad debts. Sometimes relatives will borrow money from him and will never pay back. Apart from this, business is going fine and he enjoys doing it. Outside of his business, Abdul would like to do great things for himself. He would like to buy a plot of land for his family and eventually build a house.

loans.use: buying more jeans and shirts to sell in his store

loans.name: Eric Kodjo

texts.fr:
Né en 1982 à Vogan, Monsieur A. Kodjo Eric est un jeune très dévoué qui réside aujourd’hui dans le village d’Amégnran. Ayant abandonné les études faute de moyens financiers, ce jeune s’est lancé dans la conduitebde taxi moto.
Pour se soutenir, il fait de temps en temps la conduite de moto taxi et se sert des profits tirés pour réaliser ses besoins. Très combatif, il s’est rendu compte qu’avoir sa propre moto lui serait plus rentable. Il sollicite à cet effet un financement pour s’acheter un engin qu’il mettra en circulation.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Vogan, Mr. Kodjo Eric A. is a very devoted young man who resides in the village of Amégnran. Having abandoned school due to a lack of means, this youngster began driving a motorbike taxi. To support himself, he works as a taxi driver from time to time and uses the profits for what he needs. An assertive man, he realized that having his own motorbike would be more profitable for him. For this, he is requesting financing to acquire one, which he will put into service.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Adzovi Ahoefa

texts.fr:
Madame A. Adzoui Ahouefa vend des mèches, tissages, et défrisants pour les femmes dans son quartier de Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Elle a 43 ans, et elle a commencé ce travail depuis 2001.  Elle est mariée avec un enseignant et ils ont 3 personnes à charge.  Avec son entreprise, qui s’appelle Coiffure « MAGNIFICATE », Madame AKAKPO peut aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permit d’acheter des mèches, tissages, et défrisants afin de mieux servir ses clients pendant les fêtes de la fin d’année.
texts.en:
Ms. Adzoui Ahouefa A. sells hair extensions, weaves, and straightener for the women in her district in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 43 years old and started this business in 2001. She is married to a teacher, and they have three children to look after. Her enterprise, which is called Coiffure « MAGNIFICATE », can assist her husband with covering family expenses. This initial loan she is requesting is going to enable her to buy hair extensions, weaves, and straightener in order to serve her customers better during the year-end holiday season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, weaves, and straightener

loans.name: Atamu Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of Kadiatu S., Adama B., Mabinty F., Mary F., Maseray K., Fatu S., and Yombo S.. They have called their group "Atamu". They have received several loans through SMT. They have re-paid previous loans successfully. They each received Le 1,000,000 in their previous loan. That loan helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, and thus were able to solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for the same amount of Le 1,000,000 each to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu (left) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-three years of age, married with five children – one in college, one in secondary school, one in primary school, one in nursery school and the last is not yet of school age. Her husband is a businessman, too.

Kadiatu sells groundnuts (peanuts). She has been in this business for 20 years now. With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Kadiatu will buy about five bags of groundnuts to add to her business. She travels to the village of Bamoi to buy the groundnuts. The fare to Bamoi is Le 15,000 and she pays a Le 6,000 delivery fee for each bag of groundnuts. A bag of groundnuts costs Le 200,000. So far, Kadiatu faces no major challenge worth noting in her business. Her only challenge in life is taking good care of her children. She wants the best education for her children. With her business, she wants to make more profit so that she will be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: buying groundnuts to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Bulera Development Group

texts.en:
Francis L. is one of the executive members of Bulera Development Group in Mityana. He is a farmer with plantations of matooke (plantains), beans, maize, and groundnuts both for sale and home consumption. In addition to this, he has animals which include cows, goats, and pigs that have over the time helped him in increasing his income.

This is the sixth time he is seeking a loan from Pearl Micro-finance and he is happy that these loans have been fruitful for his business and family. Francis would like a loan to help him with employing labor on his farm and plantations for improved yield come next season.

loans.use: paying for labor on his farmland

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 25-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a mechanic for four years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new and more sophisticated tools for his business. This is the first time that Moustafa has requested a loan.

Moustafa is exceptional in his work because his clients are collectors and dealers of old cars, and also because of his good reputation. Moustafa’s business is to recreate the old body of used and damaged cars. When he first started his business, he had difficulties purchasing his own machinery and tools needed for the business. 

In the future, he plans to purchase a big oven for painting which will help him in his business.

loans.use: purchase new and more sophisticated tools for his business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is a 58-year-old trader. She is married with eight children. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Asokwa in Obuasi in the Ashanti region for six years. With income from her business, Ama is supporting two of her kids in senior high school while the rest are learning trades. 

Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business especially in this crucial election period in Ghana. She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and ladies slippers to serve her customers. 

She hopes to save enough to support her kids to the tertiary level. 

She is a member of the group called Revelation Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and slippers.

loans.name: Joël

texts.fr:
Né en 1978 à Dogbo, Monsieur M. Joël est un jeune maçon  très dynamique et qui, de par la qualité de son travail, est arrivé à gagner la confiance de beaucoup de gens et de certains services publiques et privés. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il vit avec sa petite famille à Aného où il exerce son métier. Très sollicité et disposant de beaucoup de chantiers dans la préfecture, il n’arrive plus à surveiller les travaux pour lesquels il mobilise souvent ses apprentis et d’autres maîtres maçons.
Son irrégularité sur les chantiers est source de mécontentement de la part des gens qui lui confient les travaux. Pour faciliter ses déplacements et pour pouvoir coordonner et superviser ses chantiers, il a besoin d’un moyen de déplacement adéquat. Des moyens financiers faisant défaut, il sollicite un crédit  pour s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Dogbo, Mr. Joël M. is a very energetic, young mason. By the quality of his work, he manages to earn the trust of many people and certain governmental and private organizations. Married and the father of three, he lives with his small family in Aného, where he practices his trade. Though he is in high demand and works at many locations in the prefecture, he is no longer able to oversee the jobs for which he often mobilizes his apprentices and master masons. His spotty work site coverage is the source of discontent for people who entrust their projects to him. To facilitate the trips he makes to coordinate and supervise his work sites, he needs a means of adequate transport. Lacking the financial means, he is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a means of transport for his work

loans.name: Jannet Milagros

texts.en:
Jannet is a member of the Alondras Village Bank. She is 19 years old and lives at home with her parents. She administers her father’s inter-provincial taxi business, since her parents travel a lot to buy car parts in other cities and bring them to Lima to sell. Jannet handles all of the money, pays the driver and the payment collector, and checks up on the taxi to see if it needs any work done. Jannet knows a lot about cars and enjoys working with them; she wanted to study to be a mechanic or a heavy machinery operator, but her father felt that these were not suitable jobs for a woman, so instead she is studying Administration. 

Jannet is requesting a loan of 1500 Soles to reupholster, paint, and buy new tires for her father’s taxi. She will also use part of the loan to pay her school fees. 

Jannet’s goal for the future is to have her own line of taxis or to sell cars.

loans.use: Reupholster, paint, and buy new tires for taxi; pay school fees

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes B., age forty-two. Agnes was born in Kabala, Koinadugu district, in northern Sierra Leone. She currently resides in Makeni where she is married and runs her business. Her husband is a teacher and they have four children. Two of the children are in secondary school and two are in primary school. Agnes sells both “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloth with fabricated designs) and eggs. She has been in business for over ten years now. This will be her very first loan through SMT. She is requesting a loan of SSL 2,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.

With this loan, Agnes will expand her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She will invest part of the loan in her gara lapper business and part into her egg business. She purchases the eggs in Freetown for SSL 100,000 per carton. The fare to Freetown is SSL 24,000 round trip. There is a SSL 1000 delivery charge for each carton of eggs transported with her from Freetown. 

She buys the materials used for making gara lappers – inks, soda, white cotton material, etc. – here in Makeni.  A piece of white cotton cloth costs her SSL 95,000 in Makeni. She estimates she will be able to get at least nine cartons of eggs and seven pieces of white cotton cloth with the loan.  She will use the balance of the loan to buy inks, soda, and powder and to pay designers to design the white cotton cloth in different styles and patterns. 

Though business on the whole is going fine for Agnes, she does, however, face two great challenges – bad debtors and sometimes slow sales. Some of her customers refuse to pay her on time while some do not repay their debts at all. This instills fear in her as a businesswoman, making it a challenge for her to know who to trust and who not to trust.

With this loan she receives through SMT, Agnes is expecting a vast improvement in her business and an incremental increase in the amount of profit she makes. The increase in profit will be reinvested into the business, some will be saved for future use and the remainder will be used to assist her husband in providing food for their household.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of cloth making material and eggs

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 19 year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a motorcycle repairman since 2001, and he is also an employee. He requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase motorcycles. 
This is the first time that Abass has requested a loan.
 Abass is special in his work because he buys and sells new and used motorcycles, and he also repairs them. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash for purchasing spare parts and motorcycles. Therefore, he decided to do this business because it is his hobby. He has experience and also has his family's support. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Abass needs the loan to purchase motorcycles.

loans.name: Liliana Margot

texts.en:
Margot is a member of the Alondras Village Bank. She is 24 years old and single. Margot sells surgical scrubs, lab coats and medical instruments and equipment to medical school students in Ayacucho. She takes orders from the students, and each month she makes a trip to Lima (nine hours from Ayacucho by bus) to buy the clothing and items they have requested. She sometimes brings non-medical items, too, like blouses and shoes, depending on what her clients request. She receives cash payments for some items, and sells others on credit.

Margot is requesting a loan of 2000 Soles to buy more medical clothing and equipment (like blood pressure gauges and stethoscopes) in Lima.

Margot’s goal for the future is to open her own store in Ayacucho to sell medical equipment.

loans.use: Buy medical clothing and equipment (blood pressure gauges, stethoscopes)

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Alondras Village Bank. She is 54 and married with six children, most of who are now adults. Isabel is an artisan; she does embroidery and sews costumes and clothing. She used to have a store in a large crafts market in Ayacucho, but it was no longer profitable, so now she sells her work from home. She has been doing embroidery since she was 15 years old, and today she has many regular clients and receives orders from Lima. She pays seven workers to embroider blouses that she sews. She sells long-sleeved blouses for 25 soles and short-sleeved blouses for 20 soles; she earns 13.50 soles in profits per blouse. She is currently sewing costumes for a local dance troupe.

Isabel is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles to buy more fabric and to pay her embroiderers. Her goal for the future is to open a store in central Ayacucho to sell clothing and rent out the costumes she makes. She thinks this could be a very profitable business, because just one rental covers the cost of making the costumes, so any future rental is 100% profit.

loans.use: Buy fabric and pay embroiderers

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Madame DAHOUE Amivi est âgée de 30 ans, et elle vend des tissus et des articles de mercerie dans son magasin qui s’appelle « MERCERIE DE HOLANDAISE ».  L’entreprise est située à Lomé, la capitale du Togo ou Madame DAHOUE est née.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Avec ce premier crédit, elle peut reconstituer son stock afin de mieux servir ses clients pendant les fêtes de la fin d’année. 
Madame DAHOUE est mariée avec un opérateur économique, et ils ont 6 personnes à charge.
texts.en:
Ms. Amivi DAHOUE is 30 years old and sells cloth and sewing supplies in her store called "MERCERIE DE HOLANDAISE". This enterprise is located in Lomé, the capital of Togo where she was born. She started this business in 2005 and has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan. With this initial loan, she can replenish her stock to serve her customers better during this year-end holiday season. Ms. DAHOUE is married to an economic controller, and they have six people in their care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and fabrics

loans.name: Yanirys Oneyda

texts.es: La Joven  Yanirys Oneyda S. S., tiene la edad de 20 años habita en el barrio monimbo ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a sus padres, ella es soltera, no tiene hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio e incrementar su inventarios; ella desde hace dos años trabaja como vendedora de zapatos para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a sus padres. Sus sueños de esta joven es llegar a establecer su negocio para poder darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia, con esta solicitud es para invertir en zapatos variados, y otros productos que pueda ofertar a sus  clientes En futuro es Poder cumplir sus metas proyectadas y lograr lo que siempre ha deseado.
texts.en:
The young woman Yanirys Oneyda S. S. is 20 years old and lives in the Monimbo neighborhood located in the city of Masaya with her parents. She is single, does not have any children and her future plans are to improve the condition of her business and increase her inventory. For the last two years she has worked selling shoes to be able to help her parents with the household expenses. The dream of this young woman is to be able to establish her business to be able to give her family a better quality of life. This request is to invest in a variety of shoes and other products that she was offer to her clients. In the future she wants to achieve the goals set and accomplish what she has always wished.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Karungi Development Group1

texts.en:
Stanley K. is a member of Karungi Development Group 1 in Mityana. He is a businessman involved in the sale of cattle that he buys from the locals and sells to buyers in the daily markets as well as transporting some of them to Kampala where he is able to sell them at a much higher price.

Stanley has been in this business for such a long time; joining his lending group was to revive his business and buy more good-looking cows that are able to bring in much revenue. Stanley has a plan of including the sale of goats and sheep in addition to the cows since there is a market for them. He needs another loan for buying cows for slaughter during and after the festive season.

loans.use: buying more cows for his business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is 58 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. By means of her business, Ama has paid the fees for one of her children to finish senior high school and the others are now working. She sells used clothing. Used clothing is purchased by most Ghanaians due to its affordability and quality.

Ama wants to use this loan to buy more bales of used clothing to expand her stock. She hopes to increase her savings to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Madame H. Afi est née à Aného où elle réside actuellement. Mariée, elle a deux (2) personnes à charge en plus de ses deux (2) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de produits de premières nécessités dans sa petite boutique. Les recettes provenant de cette activité ne suffisent pas pour assurer l’éducation de ses enfants, Madame H. Afi sollicite un financement pour approvisionner suffisamment sa boutique en marchandises fin de faire face aux demandes de sa clientèle en cette période de fin d'année pour les fêtes de noël et de nouvel an. Ainsi, elle espère augmenter considérablement ses revenus et contribuer aux charges du foyer en vue d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Afi H. is 39 years old and was born in Aného where she currently resides. She is married and has two people in her care in addition to her two children. Her main work involves selling staple items in her small shop. The receipts from this work is not enough to ensure her children's eduction. She is requesting financing to get sufficient supplies of goods for her shop in order to cope with customer demand during the year-end holidays of Christmas and New Year's Eve. Thus, she hopes to increase her revenues considerably and to help cover household expenses, so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with goods

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa P. is forty-five years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells “waakye”. "Waakye" is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni, and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy "waakye".

Adwoa wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, macaroni, etc. to prepare good "waakye" for her customers. She believes this will provide her with increased income to send her first son to the university and she is certain that when she has access to the loan, that dream would be fulfilled, come next year. She belongs to the community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, macaroni, etc. to prepare good "waakye" for her customers

loans.name: Raquel Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sr. Raquel tiene 30 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación, casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil desde hace tres años. Tiene tres hijos de 8, 11 y 13 años de edad todos están estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Con el apoyo económico de su esposo ha empezado ido cambiando poco apoco su casita pero falta mas detalles que dentro de sus planes están la construcción total y parcial de su vivienda. Requieren de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque, madera, puerta entre otros. Gracia a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra culminar su proyecto que una mayor seguridad y protección para su familia, con comodidad y un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel is 30 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliación, and is married. Her husband has been a bricklayer for three years. She has three children, who are 8, 11, and 13 years old. All of them are studying in the high school in the capital. With the financial support of her husband, she has begun renovating her house little by little, but she lacks more materials that are major components of the construction, based on her plans. They need a loan to buy construction materials like cement, iron, blocks, wood, and doors, among other things. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, they will be able to complete their project, which will give them more security and protection for their family. The home will give them more comfort and will be an asset for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish her house

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is single. He is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo. Alexander owns a business selling cell phones and accessories in one of the local stores.

Alexander is an optimist. His cheerful personality, experience working in the technical sphere and unique ability to guess customer preferences make loyal clients come back to him again and again. Alexander has been in this trade for about 2 years.

Alexander has about 40,000 Grivnas in inventory. However he would like to get a new loan to expand the assortment of his inventory for the holiday season when cell phones sell really well. Rich experience in retail and the good location of his business will guarantee stable income for Alexander. The loan will not only help Alexander get good profit and promote the growth of his business, but also give him an opportunity to save some money for personal purposes.

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Anghel

texts.en:
Anghel V. lives in Taraclia district, Balabanu village, and his main activity is growing cereals and grains including the production of seeds.

He took this loan to plant an orchard and also for agricultural purposes, including the production of seeds and breeding cattle. This is not an easy thing, but Mr. V. has gained a lot of experience in the domain of agriculture over 9 years, so he knows what he has to do, because to plant an orchard, you have to be very well-informed and have high knowledge in this domain.

He has 6.3 hectares of arable land where he grows cereals and vegetables in a greenhouse.

The purpose of the loan was also to pay for the work; and he has bees at home which produce honey that is very profitable in sales.

loans.use: for  planting an orchard

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Theresa O. is 48 year old. She is married with six children, who are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for twenty years. In addition to making palm oil from palm nuts, she is also a food vendor and serves food like rice and stew. She sells the palm oil that she does not use in the preparation of her meals to other food vendors so they can prepare their meals.

She would like to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, meat, and rice to increase her efficiency by producing meals in larger quantities. She believes this will expand her business and earn more income to support her husband in providing for her family and the financing of their children’s education. She belongs to the community organization called Abandenden Trust Group and her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide guarantee for each another, as a form of social collateral, to access loans and maintain peer pressure for loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of palm nuts, rice, vegetables, meat and firewood etc.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is raising a 10-year-old daughter all by herself, and she is very active and full of energy.  She is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo, selling women’s lingerie in a local store called “Alisa.”  Alexandra started her business four years ago, and has had about 24,000 Grivnas in capital turnover.  This type of merchandise is in constant demand.  

She is seeking to expand her business even further in order to generate additional income from increased sales.  This time Alexandra is asking for a 2,500 Grivnas loan to increase her stock.  We believe her diligent work, determination and positive attitude will help her achieve her business goals and be successful in all her endeavors.  
This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
F. Peter is a member of Bukere lending group in Mityana. He is a business man with a retail shop that the has been running for three years.  He is also a farmer, with plantations both for sale and for home consumption. 

In all of these businesses, he works hand in hand with his wife to manage all the businesses at one time.  Through their partnership, they have managed to be successful in providing for their family with six children, paying their school fees and building a family house. 

Within his loan, Peter plans to enlarge his shop with more goods, in order to increase revenues.

loans.use: More goods such as sugar, cooking oil and paraffin for his retail shop.

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr:
Born in 1968 at Aného, Mr. Folly S. is married and is a father of five (05) children with three (3) others dependents. Painter by trade, the lack of work obliged him to give up to the barroom management.  
The galloping increase of his clientele outs him to look for a meaning working capital to respond to his demand. This, to increase his income and also to provide to his family's needs.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 at Aného, Mr. Folly S. is married and is a father of five (05) children with three (3) others dependents. Painter by trade, the lack of work obliged him to give up to the barroom management.  
The galloping increase of his clientele outs him to look for a meaning working capital to respond to his demand. This, to increase his income and also to provide to his family's needs.

loans.use: To sell beverages

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar tiene 27 años de edad, habitante de barrio Héroes y Mártires,  en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa trabaja como domestica es una ingreso mas para el hogar, tiene dos hijos precioso de 1 y 10 años de edad. Sus planes en ámbito familiar es ofrecerle una mayor seguridad y protección. Don Oscar trabaja en una empresa privada desempeñando el cargo de auxiliar de bodega desde hace un  año trabaja para esa empresa. Sus objetivos es una mejor vivienda esta dentro de las prioridades principales, para realizarlo requiere de un préstamo. Gracia a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar los materiales como: cementos, hierros, ladrillos y bloques realizando la construcción de su casa y ofreciendo una mayor protección y  un patrimonio a sus hijos para el futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar is 27 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Héroes y Mártires (Heroes and Martyrs), in the capital of Managua. His wife works as a domestic, which is additional income for the household. He has 2 precious children, who are 1 and 10 years old. He plans to offer his family more security and protection. Oscar has worked in a private company, where he is in charge of helping with the wine store, for one year. One of his main goals is to have a better home. In order to achieve this, he needs a loan. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, he is able to buy materials like cement, iron, bricks, and blocks so that he can construct his house and offer more protection and an asset to his children for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr:
Madame A. a trente neuf ans d’âge, elle tient une boutique dénommée "ETS PIPI ROYAL" dans laquelle elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale au petit marché d’adidogomé. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1995. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES, avec ce premier crédit elle veut agrandir son stock de produits d’alimentation générale et compte beaucoup vendre surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année.
Madame  A. est une femme mariée, son mari est un chauffeur et ils ont ensemble un (01) enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs.Tchilalo A. is 39 years old. She operates a boutique called "Ets Pipi Royal" where she sells basic necessity items at the small marketplce in Adidogome. She has been in this business since 1995. She has never before made a loan from WAGES. With this first loan she would like to build-up her supply of basic necessity items and is counting heavily on increasing her sales during the end of year holidays

Mrs. A. is married and her husband is a driver. Together, they have one (1) child.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase increased supplies of basic necessity items for resale

loans.name: Fortunée

texts.fr:
Miss Fortunée Y. is a young lady born in 1982. Abandoning the benches very early because of her dad's death, she got involved quickly in midwife's training. Having not found a job of her specialty, she made herself hired in a pharmacy of the place.   
Abandoned by her husband, she is alone facing the need of the family composed of four (04) people. With the delays in the payment of the salary, she arrives with difficulty to survive. To remedy, she wish to buy a taxicab motorcycle.  
The profit morale from this trade will allow him to provide to the family's needs; source of her blossoming.
texts.en:
Miss Fortunée Y. is a young lady born in 1982. Abandoning the benches very early because of her dad's death, she got involved quickly in midwife's training. Having not found a job of her specialty, she made herself hired in a pharmacy of the place.   
Abandoned by her husband, she is alone facing the need of the family composed of four (04) people. With the delays in the payment of the salary, she arrives with difficulty to survive. To remedy, she wish to buy a taxicab motorcycle.  
The profit morale from this trade will allow him to provide to the family's needs; source of her blossoming.

loans.use: Achat  de taxi moto

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply her store with basic consumer goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Assimawa

texts.fr:
Born in Accra in 1964, Mrs. Assimawa A. is married and has six (06) people. Dependents at Kpémé, all the family's charges come back to her because her husband doesn't have a steady job. Dealer for five (05) years, Mrs. Assimawa A. is a courageous and devoted woman who fights for the working order of her activity and also for the success of her children. Today, to increase her business and to have a remarkable display to satisfy the needs of her clientele, she solicits this financing.  
She hopes to improve her family's living conditions, by the growth of her income and especially the schooling of her children.
texts.en:
Born in Accra in 1964, Mrs. Assimawa A. is married and has six (06) people. Dependents at Kpémé, all the family's charges come back to her because her husband doesn't have a steady job. Dealer for five (05) years, Mrs. Assimawa A. is a courageous and devoted woman who fights for the working order of her activity and also for the success of her children. Today, to increase her business and to have a remarkable display to satisfy the needs of her clientele, she solicits this financing. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions, by the growth of her income and especially the schooling of her children.

Translated from French by SaveThese Loans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Approvisionnement de sa boutique en marchandises

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es: Elfida se dedica a la venta de maíz, huevos, aguas gaseosas, y venta de ropa para damas y niños, tiene ya doce años con el negocio. Ella inició su negocio únicamente vendiendo tamales y helados, pero la misma necesidad de poder ganar un poco más de dinero le hicieron buscar otros productos que vender, así fue como inicio con la venta de de maíz, el cual compra en el mercado de la Terminal en la ciudad capital, y lo lleva a su aldea Chixolis en Santiago Sacatepequez, donde lo vende entre sus vecinos y amigos.  Conforme fue adquiriendo clientes, ellos le pedían otras cosas, así fue que empezó a vender huevos, aguas gaseosas y ropa.  Ella tiene 4 hijos, y su esposo es le apoya en su negocio, ella quiere invertir el crédito para comprar una cantidad mayor de mercadería, ya que es más barato comprar por mayor, ella desea tener bien surtido se negocio para poder incrementar también sus ganancias.  Sus metas son poder ir mejorando su casa, ya con mucho esfuerzo han luchado para tener su propia casa, ya que ella y su esposo son originarios de la costa sur del país.  Por todo eso ella sigue luchando para mejorar y tener un lugar digno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elfida sells corn, eggs, soda water, and clothes for women and children. She has been in the business for twelve years. She began her business only selling tamales and ice cream, but the need to earn more money made her look for other products to sell. It was in this way that she began to sell corn, which she buys in the Terminal market in the capital city. She brings it to her village of Chixolis in Santiago Sacatepequez, where she sells her products among her neighbors and friends. As she got more clients, they asked Elfida for other things. Because of this, she began to sell eggs, soda water, and clothes. She has 4 children, and her husband helps her in her business. She wants to invest the loan to buy more merchandise because it is cheaper to buy at wholesale. She wants to have a well-stocked business so that she can also increase her earnings. Her goals are to be able to continue improving her house. She has already fought with a lot of strength to have her own house, since she and her husband are originally from the Southern coast of the country. Because of all of this, she continues fighting to improve and have a dignified home for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business to sell corn and eggs

loans.name: Pascaline Dédé

texts.fr:
Aged of 46 years, Mrs. Pascaline Dédé H. is married and is mother of three (03) children. Endowed with a good morality, she has for main activity the management of a haberdashery. Considering the profitability of this activity, she would like to increase her business to buy surfilage and press buttons machinery to best satisfy her clientele.  
The profit drew from this project will serve to provide to her family's needs the especially her children schooling she wishes highly that to accomplish.
texts.en:
Aged of 46 years, Mrs. Pascaline Dédé H. is married and is mother of three (03) children. Endowed with a good morality, she has for main activity the management of a haberdashery. Considering the profitability of this activity, she would like to increase her business to buy surfilage and press buttons machinery to best satisfy her clientele. The profit drew from this project will serve to provide to her family's needs the especially her children schooling she wishes highly that to accomplish.

Translated from French by SaveThese Loans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d'un presse bouton et d'articles de mercerie

loans.name: Ardica 2 Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

Nous avons déja une expérience dans le domaine de la production et la vente de volailles. C'est pour cela que nous venons auprès de Kiva demander un financement pour pouvoir mener à bien une activité pour laquelle nous avons déja reçu une formation. Nous somes à notre deuxième xpérience en ce qui concerne les prêts de Kiva, que notre association a réussi à rembourser à temps et que cette fois-ci nous avons décidé de faire autre chose pour fournir notre écovillage en poulet de chaire et en même temps en fournir dans les villages qui nous entoure et qui vont très loins pour en chercher.
texts.en:
We already have experience in the field of raising and selling poultry. This is why we are coming to Kiva to ask for financing for carrying out our work, on which we have already received training. This is our second experience with regard to Kiva loans that our association has succeeded in repaying on time. We decided to do something else this time to supply our eco-village with fryer chickens. Meanwhile, the surrounding villages, which go to a lot of effort to get such chickens, can also be supplied by us.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks and supplies for raising chickens

loans.name: Mbokatoor Group

texts.fr: C'est une demande de prêt de groupe soumise par les cinq membres de l'association Mbookator, représentée par Bineta D..  Palmarin, village situé dans la région de Fatick au centre du Sénégal, est un village de pêcheurs qui après Joal, est l’un des plus grands fournisseurs de poissons dans la petite côte. La principale activité des femmes de la localité reste la transformation et le séchage du poisson et d’autres produits de mer. Bineta et ses associées planifient de profiter de cette ressource naturelle en achetant une quantité de ces produits naturels frais (poissons, huitres, crevettes, moules, sel) et de le transformer. Cela pour répondre à l’appel des populations en besoin en produits halieutiques dans Palmarin, villages environnants et même à Dakar.
texts.en:
This is a group loan request being submitted by the assocation Mbookator, represented by Ms. Bineta D.. Palmarin, located in the Fatick region in the middle of Senegal, is a fishing village that, after Joal, is one of the greatest producers of fish in the region of La Petite Côte. The main work of the women of the town is still the processing and drying of fish and other seafood. Bineta and her associates plan to take advantage of this natural resource by buying large quantities of fresh, natural products (fish, oysters, shrimp, mussels, salt) and to process them in order to respond to the call of the people living in Palmarin, in surrounding villages, and even in Dakar needing ocean-harvested goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for processing into seafood products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet Y. is 43 year old and married woman with six children.  Three of her children have completed high school while the youngest three are still in school.  Janet runs a business selling a variety of footwear, ranging from shoes to slippers, for all age groups.  

She has managed this business for three years.  Janet buys her goods from big cities and sells them at the local markets. According to her, business has been going well, despite her limited working capital.  It is Janet’s dream to expand her business by trekking to other towns to market her goods. This will require an increase in her working capital, hence, the request for the loan. 

Janet is in the “Kristo Tease” (meaning, Christ lives) Trust Bank group in her community.  In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of footwear

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr:
Agé de 35 ans, Monsieur A. Tété est marié et a à sa charge sept (07) personnes. Son activité génératrice de revenu est la pêche. Le revenu de cette activité lui permet de nourrir sa famille et d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Mais aujourd’hui, la qualité de ses filets de travail ne lui permet pas d'avoir de bons rendements afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter au jour le jour. Pour y remédier, il voudrait acheter d'autres filets de pêche qui lui serviront mieux.
La réalisation de ce projet l’aidera à augmenter son revenu source pour son épanouissement et celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Tété A. is 35 years old, married, and has seven people in his care. His income-generating work involves fishing. The income from this work enables him to feed his family and to ensure his children are schooled. But today, his nets are in bad shape and prevent him day in and day out from having the good catches needed to satisfy his ever-growing customer base. To remedy the situation, he would like to buy other fishing nets that will serve him better. The success of this project will help him to increase his income source, so that he and his family may thrive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nets for fishing

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is 49 years old and married with five children.  Two of her children have completed senior high school.  Joyce has owned her own business producing and supplying palm oil to wholesale dealers for the last five years.  She buys the palm fruits from the surrounding villages, where prices are quite economical.  Joyce intends to expand her business in order to meet the increasing demand of her customers by producing the oil in bulk.  

She believes that with the loan she can increase her profit margin and help her husband take very good care of their children.  Joyce is a member of the group called “Kristo Tease” (meaning, Christ lives) Trust Group in her community. In this group, the members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To expand palm oil business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame A. Abla, a pour activité principale, le commerce de pagnes. Cette activité très rentable, lui procure le minimum possible pour s’occuper de sa famille. Son mari n’ayant pas d’emploi, n’arrive pas à l’aider dans les besoins de la famille. Ainsi, pour augmenter son revenu et de mieux s’occuper de ses enfants, elle sollicite ce financement pour gonfler son fonds de commerce. Très douée dans la gestion financière, elle est capable gérer son commerce et assurer sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abla A. is married and the mother of three children, her main activity is the sale of pagnes [Traditional African fabric]. This profitable business brings in just the minimum income to provide for her family. Her husband is unemployed and cannot help her provide for the family's needs. Thus to increase her income and to better take care of her children, she is requesting this loan to increase her business. She is very talented in financial management, and she is able to manage her business and ensure profitability.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of pagnes [Traditional African fabric]

loans.name: Ndiaye Kunda Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes des habitants de l'écovillage d'Elinkine qui est un port de pêche où débarque des tonnes de poissons frais qui sont ensuite transformés et exportés vers les autres villes du pays. Nous voulons créer une activité de commercialisation de poissons frais que nous pouvons acheter chez les pêcheurs pour ensuite aller les revendre à Ziguinchor et dans les villes envoronnantes.  C'est une activité très lucrative qui demande cependant des moyens financiers pour faire face à la demande des populations éloignées des côtes de débarquement. C'est pour faire face à cette situation qui nous permettra de lutter contre la pauvreté et l'oisiveté de nos enfants que nous sommes venus solliciter un financement à Kiva. C'est aussi une activité qui nous permet d'avoir un emploi pour faire face aux besoins de nos famille qui vivent sous une pauvreté extrème.
texts.en:
We are inhabitants of the eco-village Elinkine, which is a fishing port where tonnes of fresh fish are unloaded, processed, and exported to other cities in the nation. We want to create a business for marketing fresh fish, such that we can buy from fishermen and then go resell the fish in Ziguinchor and in surrounding cities. This is a very lucrative business that yet requires financial means to address the demands of people distant from coastal access. Addressing this situation, which will enable us to fight poverty and idleness among our children, is the reason why we have come to request financing from Kiva. Also, this is a business that provides us with the employment for coping with the needs of our families, who living in extreme poverty.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in fresh fish

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame A. Angèle est spécialisée dans le commerce des denrées alimentaires il y a 13 ans. Dotée d’une bonne moralité et très douée dans la gestion, cette activité l’aide beaucoup dans les charges de sa famille. Malgré que son mari soit sans emploi, elle ne le sent pas beaucoup, car son activité lui rapporte beaucoup. 
Pour mieux faire, elle voudrait augmenter son chiffre d’affaires par ce financement en approvisionnant suffisamment sa boutique en marchandises. Une fois cet objectif atteint, elle assurera le plein épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Angèle A. is married and the mother of four. She has been a specialist in the commerce of grocery items for thirteen years. Of good character and very talented in management, she helps her family a lot to cover expenses through her work. Despite her husband being unemployed, she isn’t impacted very much because her work brings in a great deal. To do better, she would like to increase her sales figures through this financing by getting sufficient supplies of goods for her shop. Once this is achieved, she will ensure that her children will thrive fully.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is a forty-five-year-old divorced woman and a mother of four children. She says that all her children have completed school. 

A. produces two different kinds of local vegetable oil, palm oil and palm kernel oil. Palm oil is produced from the food of the palm fruit. Palm kernel oil is from the seed of the of the palm fruit. A. buys the palm fruit from the surrounding towns. 

She has been in this business for over six years and, through this business, she has been able to sponsor all of her children through high school. She wants to expand her business and her profit margin so she can sponsor some of her children to the tertiary level. 

A. is in the “Kristo Tease” (Christ Lives) Trust Bank group in her community. In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and co-guarantee to repay the loan.

loans.use: To expand oil production business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is a trader with a senior high school education. She sells provisions like milk, Milo, sugar and so on at Elmina. She is married and has three dependents, and her husband is also a worker.

Nana has been selling provisions since 2005. She needs a loan to buy more rice, Milo, oil and so on to resell in her shop at Elmina. She will then use the profits to pay bills and to educate her grandchildren.

She is pictured with samples of what she sells.

loans.use: She will use the money to buy more rice, Milo, oil and so on to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Agé de 39 ans, Monsieur A. Dovi est marié et père de trois (03) enfants avec à sa charge trois (03) autres personnes. Sa principale activité est l'achat et la vente d'appareils électroniques usagers qui lui rapporte beaucoup. Disposant d’une capacité d’entreprenariat et de bonne gestion, il tire un profit énorme de son commerce qu’il met au service de sa famille, pour son épanouissement. Pour mieux faire, il voudrait renforcer son fonds de commerce par ce financement.
texts.en:
Mr. Dovi A. is 39 years old, married, and the father of three children, plus he has three others in his care. His main work, selling used electronic equipment, brings in a lot. Making use of his entrepreneurial and good management skills, he derives an enormous profit from his business that he puts towards his family members, so that they may thrive. To do better, he would like to boost his working capital through this financing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in used electronic equipment

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Née à Tsévié en 1949, Madame K. Adjoa est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Résident à Aného depuis 32 ans, le commerce de farine de manioc et du poisson est sa principale activité. Son ancienneté dans la profession lui confère une expérience de bonne gestionnaire. Dynamique et sérieuse, son activité lui rapporte beaucoup et l’aide à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Voulant renforcer son activité par l’achat des produits en gros dans les zones de production, elle sollicite un crédit. Le revenu qu’elle va en tirer servira à mieux assurer les besoins de sa famille pour son plein épanouissement.
texts.en:
Born in Tsévié in 1949, Mrs. Adjoa K. is married and the mother of 4 children. She has lived in Aného for 32 years. She sells manioc flour and fish as her main business. The fact that she has been involved in this business for such a long time shows she has lots of management experience in her business.

Dynamic and serious, she gets a lot out of her business and it helps her to cover the needs of her family. She would now like to bolster her business by buying her products wholesale where they are produced, so she is asking for a loan. The income that it will bring her will help her better support her family so that they can flourish.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and selling manioc flour

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba A. is a trader; she sells firewood and charcoal at Iture near Elmina. She is divorced and has five dependents. She has been in this business since 2006.

Araba will use the money from her loan to buy more goods to sell. She will use her profits to expand her business and increase her income to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Luz Crisalda

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Ayni Village Bank; “Ayni” means “help one another” in Quechua. She is 54 years old and is a widow. She has three children, who have all graduated from college with professional degrees. Luz knits sweaters and decorative cloths in her free time, which she sells from her home. She works as an elementary school teacher during the week.

Luz is requesting a loan of 1050 soles to buy about 16 bags of high-quality wool for knitting.

Luz has been working with the Ayni Village Bank for five years now. Her goal for the future is to retire from teaching and start working with other women who knit and take orders for items.

loans.use: Buy 16 bags of high-quality wool for knitting

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is a member of the Ayni Village Bank; “Ayni” means “help one another” in Quechua. She is 63 years old and single. She sells clothing in the city of Ayacucho. The clothing is brought in from larger cities, and Maria Teresa distributes it to different stores.

Maria Teresa is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy women’s clothing. Her goal for the future is to open her own clothing store in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Adoudé

texts.fr:
Agée de 38 ans, Madame Adoudé A. est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Couturière de profession, elle achète des tissus, confectionne des habits et vêtements et les met en vente. Cette idée qu’elle a entreprise l’aide beaucoup à s’occuper de sa famille car génératrice de revenus.
Pour avoir un fonds de commerce important et aller acheter en gros dans les grandes boutiques, elle sollicite un crédit. Cet objectif, une fois atteint, lui permettra de coudre les habits en grande quantité qu'elle peut mettre à la disposition de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter et aussi aller vendre dans les autres grands marchés environnants. 
Le revenu réalisé lui permettra de mieux aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
38 years old, Adoudé A. is married and the mother of 3 children. A seamstress by profession, she buys fabrics to make outfits and clothing and sell them. This helps her greatly in supporting her family as the business generates an income. She is asking for this loan to have working capital and be able to buy wholesale from the big stores. Once she has done this, she will sew a large number of outfits which she will display to her clientele, which continues to grow in number, as well as sell the finished clothing in large neighbouring markets. The revenue she will make will enable her to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sew and sell clothing

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is twenty-eight years of age and is married with three children. Two of the children are in school and the last born is still being breastfed. 

Margaret enjoys trading and has been selling smoked fish for six years. She buys the smoked fish from the surrounding towns where the cost is quite economical. She wants to buy fish in bulk in order to save some transportation costs, and then trek to nearby towns to do business. 

She is, therefore, requesting for a loan to enable her to do this. Margaret is in the “Kristo Tease” (Christ Lives) Trust Bank group in her community where the group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and co-guarantee to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger stocks of smoked fish.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Agé de 32 ans, Monsieur A. Gilbert est né au Bénin et réside actuellement à Kpémé. Marié, il a à sa charge sept (07) personnes. Mécanicien chauffeur, Monsieur A. Gilbert conduit son propre taxi depuis sept ans. Mais aujourd’hui, pour cause du vieillissement du moteur, il est confronté à des pannes permanentes. Ce qui à un effet sur son revenu journalier. Ainsi il n’arrive plus à dégager des revenus lui permettant de s’occuper de sa famille. 
Pour y remédier il voudrait s’acheter un autre moteur pour son taxi de transport. Mais faute de moyens financiers, il sollicite un financement à cette fin.
texts.en:
Mr Gilbert A. is 32 years old. He was born in Benin and now lives in Kpeme. He is married and has seven (7) dependents. Mr. Gilbert is a mechanic and taxi driver, and has driven his own taxi for the past seven years. Today, because of the age of the taxi's motor, he is confronted with major repairs. This is having an effect on his daily income. He is no longer able to earn sufficient income to meet the needs of his family. To remedy this, he would like to purchase a new motor for his taxi. He is requesting a small loan to achieve this.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is a fifty-year-old widowed mother of one child. She produces palm oil and treks to towns to market it. She also owns a palm plantation farm from which she gets most of her palm nuts to prepare the oil. She has been in business for four years. 

According to B., the palm nuts she harvests from her farm alone are not enough to prepare the quantity of oil needed to meet the demand of her customers. This also limits the number of markets she can trek to in order to do business. 

She wants a loan to invest into her business by buying more palm nuts so that she can increase her production. B. is in the “Tumi Wura” Trust Bank in her community. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To expand buy palm oil production business

loans.name: Méyévi

texts.fr:
Née à Sègbowoè en 1969, Madame S. Méyévi est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Dynamique, dévouée et soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants, elle se lance dans le commerce de céréales et de produits vivriers (Mais, riz, haricots, mil etc...) depuis 21 ans.
Aujourd’hui, face à la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a besoin d’un fond considérable pour être à la hauteur. Ainsi, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner. Cette opportunité lui permettra sans doute de participer à la stabilité économique de sa famille et de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Méyévi Sodegacji was born in Sègbowoè in 1969 and is married with five children. Dynamic, dedicated and concerned for her children's future, she has been working in cereal and food production (corn, rice, beans, millet etc) for twenty one years. Today, due to the ever increasing demand of her customers, she needs considerable funds to allow her to be equal to the task. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to purchase supplies. This is an opportunity that will undoubtedly allow her to contribute to her family's financial security and to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Holly Miller, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cereals

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty years old. She is married with six children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a food vendor who has been cooking for fifteen years. A. cooks rice with stew and sells it on a table top on the streets. She sells from the morning to the evening to the people of her community. 

A. buys bags of rice and other food items, such as cooking oil, fish, and meat, in the city. Ingredients such as tomatoes and pepper are readily available in her community. She wants to buy in bulk the ingredients that are not common to come by in her community. 

A. belongs to the group called “Tumi Wura” Trust Bank in her community. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda B., age twenty-six, is married with two children who are both in the elementary school. Linda bakes and sells bread. She bakes the bread with materials such as flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, etc. She sells the bread at an intersection in her community where a number of people pass daily. Linda buys the materials from the surrounding towns. She mixes the flour with the necessary ingredients at the flour mill in her locality. 

Linda wants to expand this business by increasing her production rate to meet the increasing demand of her customers and also supply to her retailers. 

Linda belongs to the group called “Tumi Wura” Trust Bank in her community. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and also to repay the loan.

loans.use: To expand bread-baking business

loans.name: Djilaco Noudioucal Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/oussouye.php

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui ont subit une formation dans la fabrication de savons locaux à base de produit écologiques comme la myhrre, l'huile de palmiste et d'autres types d'herbes très bonnes pour la santé dermique. Cela fait déja un bon bout de temps que nous travaillons sur cette activité, mais toujours de façon très limité par manque de moyens financiers qui nous empéchaient de produire à grande échelle. Le produit que nous fabricons est très recherché dans le marché local et dans la sous région. C'est pour produire en quantité importante que nous sommes venues solliciter un prêt à Kiva afin de pouvoir satisfaire la demande qui grandit de plus en plus. Ce financement nous prmettra aussi de sortir de la misère dans laquelle nous vivons tous les jours, en nous permettant de faire face aux frais de scolarité de nos enfants et de soutenir nos maris dans nos foyers.
texts.en:
We are a group of women who have undergone training in the making of local soaps made from ecological materials, such as myrrh, palm oil, and other types of plant material that are very good for dermal health. It's been a good bit of time that we've worked on this business but always in a very limited manner. This is due to a lack of financial means which prevent us from producing on a large scale. The product we make is highly sought after in the local marketplace and in the region. Producing in sizable quantities is the reason why we have come to request a loan from Kiva. We could then meet the burgeoning demand. This financing will also enable us to lift ourselves out of poverty, in which all of us live every day, by allowing us to cope with school fees for our children and to support our husbands in our homes. http://sem-fund.org/oussouye.php

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy myrrh oil, palm oil, caustic soda, and other ingredients for skin soap

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta always lives with the guidance of the Lord. She is not only a servant of God but a servant of her community. She is actually one of the councilors in their barangay. She manages a hog raising business. Now, she plans to get a loan of at least Php4,000 to buy two additional pigs to raise to increase their income. Some of the money will be used to buy feeds supply. When her hog raising business becomes stable, Julieta wants to expand to other types of business such as putting up a small store to help their financial needs. Her word of honor made Julieta a determined woman to pursue what she has planned and started. This principle motivates her towards the success of everything she is taking.

loans.use: Julieta would like to purchase two pigs and feed supply.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
“To work as hard as I can is one of my goals in life, because I know that as I aim to uplift the life of my family, I really have to make things to make it a reality,” Yolanda said. Yolanda N. is a 46 year old businesswoman. She is married to Agustin, a furniture worker and they are blessed with six children, and another who has passed away. Their children are: Imee Rose – 24 years old, married, a high school undergraduate; Sheryll – 22 years old, a college graduate and now working in Manila; Ferdinand – 21 years old, in his 1st year college; Richard – 18 years old, an elementary graduate; Val – 9 years old and Ramil Jay – 8 years old, both are studying in their elementary grades. They live in a community where furniture making is the major source of income for most of the residents.
