The current loan is for the purchase of raw materials or additional merchandise to sell, as well as the purchase of work tools to improve the quality of their products and maximize their production, particularly of their textiles.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a trader at Abrobemu near Elmina. She is single and has five dependents. She sells fabric and kitchen utensils, which she has been doing since 2002. She has received education through senior high school.

Mary will use the extra money from this loan to buy more materials and kitchen utensils to sell at the market. She plans to use the money gained from her expanded business to cater for her family and also save towards a house she wants to build for her children.

loans.use: To buy more materials and kitchen utensils to sell at the market.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa B. is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids. Currently all four of the children are in school. As old as she is, Yaa loves to sell. She has been selling fresh and smoked (dried) fish for five years to support her family. She treks to the city of Kumasi in the Ashanti region to buy her stock of fish from the wholesalers and fishmongers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of fish to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and also save part to celebrate the Christmas with them. Yaa is a member of a community group called All Nations Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. Yaa would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy cartons of fresh and dried fish

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna O. sells provisions and drinks. She has been in the business for a long time. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She needs a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah D. is a trader. He sells goods like footwear, fabric and so on at Abrobemu; he has been doing this since 1995. He is married and has five dependents, and his wife is also a trader. He has received education through senior high school.

Abdullah intends to use the loan to buy fabric and more sandals for resale at the market. The profit he makes will be used to pay the school fees of his children and also to expand his business.

On the table are some fabrics - samples of what he sells

loans.use: To buy fabric and more sandals for resale at the market.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday A. is a commercial motorcyclist and sells spare parts for motorcycles. He needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase one motorcycle to enable him to meet the demands of his customers. He is 42 years old and married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one motorcycle

loans.name: Balisika

texts.en:
Balikisa I. is a 40-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with four children. With income from her business, she has provided for two of her children to graduate from high school.

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. She has being in business for the past eight years now. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Balikisa says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and that she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

She is a member of the group called All Nations. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi O. sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started her business in 2004. She is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She need a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Sonia is 36 years old and is married with one child. Sonia sells different kinds of sweets from the door of her home, which is near a school. She works everyday. She also travels to regional markets, where she buys cheese and garlic. She sends the cheese to Lima for her sister to sell there, and she peels the garlic and sells it by the kilogram. Sonia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy cheese and sweets. Sonia dreams of improving her home, improving her business, and that her son will grow up to be a good, working professional.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor.

Sonia es casada, tiene 36 años y 1 hijo, Sonia vende golosinas variadas, actividad que realiza en la puerta de su casa, todos los días, su casa esta ubicada cerca de un colegio. Además viaja a las ferias de la regio en donde compra quesos y ajo, los quesos lo envía a Lima a su hermana para que lo comercializa y los ajos los pela y lo vende por kilos.

Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos y golosinas. Sonia sueña con mejorar su casa, mejorar su negocio y que su hijo sea un buen profesional.

loans.use: Buy cheese and sweets

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet A. sells Ogogoro, a local gin. She started her business in 2007 and hopes to expand. She is 49 years old and a widow with 3 children. Juliet needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more Ogogoro to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more Ogogoro (local gin) to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. Elizabeth is a 25-year-old single mother with one daughter. Elizabeth has a carpentry workshop in her house on Arenales Avenue, which she inherited from her father. She sells wood and also makes custom furniture. She sometimes sells her furniture in the San Juan Sunday market. Elizabeth needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy tornillo wood (tornillo is a tropical tree used to make furniture). Elizabeth dreams of buying a saw for her workshop and of outfitting her house.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.

Elizabeth es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Elizabeth tiene una carpintería que fue heredado de su padre, su carpintería esta ubicada en su domicilio en la Av. Arenales, donde fabrican muebles por pedido y también vende madera. En algunas oportunidades vende muebles en la feria de San Juan.

Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera tornillo.

Elizabeth sueña con comprar una cortadora para implementar su taller y equipar su casa.

loans.use: Buy tornillo wood to make furniture

loans.name: Omavon

texts.en: Omavon is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells electrical materials like bulbs, wire, etc. She hopes to stock her shop with more electrical materials. She needs a loan of N30, 000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. Edith is 24 years old and lives with her partner; they are currently expecting their first child. Edith sells wood to carpentry workshops. Her father sends her the wood in the family car from the Ayacuchan jungle, where he lives. Edith needs a loan to 750 soles to buy wood. Edith dreams of buying a bigger car to transport her products and of finishing her studies to get her degree as an Executive Secretary.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.

Edith es conviviente, tiene 24 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Edith vende madera, lo ofrece a carpinterías, las maderas son enviadas por su papa que vive en la selva ayacuchana, lo transportan con carro propio.

Edith necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.

Edith sueña con comprar un carro mas grande para transportar sus productos y terminar de estudiar su carrera de secretariado ejecutivo.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 37 years old and married and 3 children. She sells phones accessories. She travels to Onitsha to purchase phones accessories to sell in Benin City. She has been in this business for a long time. Victoria needs a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more phones accessories to sell

loans.name: San José De Ñahuinpuquio Group

texts.en:
The St. Joseph of Ñahuinpuquio Village Bank (loan group) is loacted in Huancavelica state. This community is located on the highway to Huancayo, where “La Morenada,” a traditional Carnaval dance, brings community members together. There is a lot of commerce and agriculture in the region; local produce is exported to Huancayo and other cities.

Maria V. is married and has five children. She sells potatoes and vegetables in the Acobamba and Izachaca Markets. She says that before FINCA (Kiva's Field Partner) came, there were no loans for the people of her village, or if there were, banks asked them for property titles or other financial guarantees. With the help of her FINCA loans, Maria V. buys more vegetables in Huancayo and earns more. Her dream is to open a dry goods store.

Luz V. is married and has two children. She sells gasoline and also has a store in the town center. Thanks to her village bank, she is learning to be more responsible and to save. Her dream is to own her own home. Currently she lives with her in-laws.

Hermitania H. is married and has two children. She sells vegetables and a little meat in local markets. With her loans, she would like to expand her business to better serve her clients. She would like to have her own tractor for plantings and harvests. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow El Bancomunal San José de Ñahuinpuquio, esta ubicado en el departamento de Huancavelica, esta comunidad se encuentra ubicado de la carretera cerca de la ciudad de Huancayo, done el folclor de la morenada reúne a todos los comuneros, hay bastantes agricultores, donde exportan para a Huancayo y otras ciudades, es una zona bastante agrícola, hay mucho comercio.

Maria V., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, vende papa y verduras en las ferias de Acostambo e Izcuchaca, ella manifiesta que antes no había prestamos para la gente de su pueblo, los bancos le pedían aval, títulos de propiedad, etc. Con la ayuda de sus prestamos Maria V. compra mas verduras en Huancayo y así obtiene mas ganancias. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de abarrotes.

Luz Velásquez, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de gasolina y tiene una tienda surtida en el centro, gracias a su bancomunal esta aprendiendo a ser mas responsable y a ahorrar, su sueño es tener su propia casa, actualmente vive en casa de sus suegros.

Hermitania Huamán, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de verdura en las ferias y también vende un poco de carne, con sus prestamos desea incrementar su negocio, para atender mejor a sus clientes. Le gustaría tener su propio tractor para sus sombríos y cosechas.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, gasoline, and other inventory to sell.

loans.name: Iyabor

texts.en: Iyabor sells clothes and sarongs. She started this business in 2002. The demands for her clothes are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after the festive season.  Iyabor needs a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell.  Iyabor is 33 years old and married with a child. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana tiene 57 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde los 8 años aprendió lo que es el trabajo duro y esforzado en las duras tareas del campo, también aprendió de su madre a elaborar todo tipo de tejidos. Ella es agricultora, su producto principal es la papa, entre otras variedades nativas de su zona, mientras Adriana espera la ansiada cosecha, busca recursos adicionales para generarse ingresos, uno de ellos es tejer fustanes de lana, los que vende en las ferias comerciales de su localidad. Ahora Adriana tiene  muchas expectativas con la época de siembra que esta próxima, y con mucho cuidado está seleccionando las semillas de papa, porque de ello depende su cosecha y ganancia. Es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, su gran sentido de responsabilidad ha hecho de ella, una de las clientas más confiables. En esta ocasión Adriana solicita esta cantidad que invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Adriana, 57, lives with her husband and children. She is a very hard-working woman; at 8 years old, she was already working in the farming fields of her parents, learning the tough work that farming requires. She also learned weaving and knitting from her mother. Adriana is a farmer. Her main crop is potatoes, but also grows other native crops. While she waits for the harvest season, Adriana looks for other ways to supplement her income. On way is to weave wool skirts and sell them in the local markets. Now Adriana has good expectations of her next crop. She is carefully choosing potato seeds, since a good harvest and her profits depend on them. This is Adriana's fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She has become one of our most responsible and trustworthy of our clients. With this loan, Adriana will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 42 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She travels to Onitsha to purchase sarongs and clothes to sell. She started this business after the death of her husband. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es: Betzabe tiene 59 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus hijas. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace un año, anteriormente alquilaba un espacio en su casa para la tienda de otra persona, pero surgió en ella la idea de  tener un propio negocio que le permita tener ingresos, es así que ahora vende productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes que llegan a ser sus propios vecinos. Esta actividad es del agrado de Betzabe porque se distrae y disfruta de atender a los clientes, su meta es tener una tienda variada mercadería y seguir creciendo. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y en el primer ciclo demostró ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más mercadería, como sacos de arroz y de azúcar.
texts.en:
Betzabe, 59, lives with her husband and daughters. She opened a small grocery store in a room of her home a year ago. She used to rent the room for another person's grocery store, but she saw that she could have a business of her own in that space, and now she offers basic products to her neighbors who have become her customers. Betzabe enjoys this activity and the interaction with her customers. Her goal is to add more products to her store, and to keep her business growing. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP. On her first loan, she made all her payments on time. Betzabe will use the loan to purchase more merchandise like sacks of rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory in store

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She sells drinks at wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. The demands for her drinks are high. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Daría

texts.es: Daría tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, desde hace 4 años, se inicia en este negocio al ser animada por sus amistades para emprender este reto. Ahora, nos cuenta que con esta actividad le va muy bien y desea expandir sus horizontes. Daría se siente contenta con esta labor porque le permite un ingreso más para su hogar, sobre todo para solventar los estudios de sus hijos. Diariamente, luego de cocinar los alimentos, su trabajo consiste en salir a ofrecer los productos de belleza y venderlos, en ocasiones da crédito, pero solo a personas que ha logrado tener confianza, esta actividad le permite disponer de tiempo para no descuidar las tareas de su hogar. Daría solicita este préstamo para invertir en la compra de más cosméticos y tener así mayor capital de trabajo (lo principal que comprará son lápices labiales y sombras de ojos).
texts.en:
Daría, 33, lives with her husband and their 2 children. She has been selling cosmetics by catalog for 4 years. She was encouraged by her friends to undertake the challenge of starting the business. Now, she tells us that it is going very well for her, and she wants to expand her horizons. Daría is happy with this work because it gives her more income for her home, above all to pay for her children's education. Daily, after preparing the meal, her work consists of going out to present and sell beauty products. She occasionally gives credit, but only to persons who have earned her trust. The work allows her to use the time when she is not needed in the home. Daría is requesting this loan to buy more cosmetics and to have increased working capital. (The main things she will buy are lipsticks and eye shadows.)

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of increased quantity of cosmetics

loans.name: Virgen De La Natividad Group

texts.en:
The Virgen D. la Natividad Village Bank is located in the Ñahunpuquio community in Huancavelica Department, Peru. The community is located in a primarily agricultural area with many hectares of crops. The main activities in the area are farming, raising livestock, and commerce.

Otilia is married and has four adult children, who still live with her. She has a store where she sells fruits, vegetables, and many other items. She will use her loan to offer a wider variety of merchandise in her store and expand the business.

Elisa Huamán is married. She sells potatoes in the markets each week. She does not have much investment capital, so she sells in small quantities. She would like to buy sweets and start selling juice from her home.

Raquel R. is married, runs a gas station, and sells dry goods. She likes group bank meetings because it gives her a chance to chat with her fellow group members. She is more sociable now, and has learned to save money. She wants to use her savings to have a hot chocolate party for all the children in her village.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow El Bancomunal Virgen D. la Natividad esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Ñahunpuquio en el departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es una zona agrícola ganadera, donD. los sombríos se expanden por hectáreas. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Otilia, es casada y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores que aun viven con ella, tiene una tienda donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos entre frutas y verduras, con su préstamo desea surtir su negocio y hacerlo crecer.

Elisa Huamán, es casada, se dedica a la venta D. papa en las ferias que se realizan semanalmente, no tiene mucho capital por eso venD. en poca cantidad, le gustaría comprar golosinas y abrir una juguería en su casa.

Raquel R., es casada, tiene un grifo y venD. abarrotes, le gusta las reuniones D. su bancomunal porque pueD. conversar con sus compañeras, ahora es mas sociable y esta aprendiendo a ahorrar pues quiere realizar una chocolatada para todos los niños D. su pueblo.

loans.use: To buy more produce, sweets, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a 32-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been working as a car painter since 2005. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and tools for his business. This is the first time that Jaber has requested a loan.

Jaber is special in his work because he is honest with his clients. His clients are friends and neighbors. He decided to open his own business because of his experience and professionalism. In the future, he plans to expand his business and to sustain it.

loans.use: Jaber needs the loan to purchase merchandise and tools for his business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 27 years old and single. He sells electrical materials like bulbs, wire, etc. Victor is a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase electrical materials for sell

loans.name: Nuevo Dia Group

texts.en:
The Nuevo Dia (“New Day”) Village Bank (loan group) has 17 members, all women, and is currently beginning its fourth loan cycle. The group members are involved in a variety of businesses: they sell food, clothing, grains, dry goods, handicrafts, and books, and work as cosmetologists. They sell their wares from home, on the street, from house to house, and in markets.

Miriam is 25 years old and lives with her partner and their child. Miriam is an artisan and makes retablos (small, brightly painted wooden altarpieces depicting scenes of traditional Ayacuchan life) and knits items from alpaca wool. She works with her sisters, and they sell their wares from home. Miriam will use her loan to buy wool and paints.

Lourdes is 29 years old and lives with her partner and their daughter. Lourdes has a restaurant in a rented space. She works there everyday with her sister and one cook. Lourdes will use her loan to buy sugar and rice.

The group members need loans of different amounts. Many are requesting 200, 400 or 800 soles, and the group as a whole is requesting a total of 7,800 soles. Group members will use their loans to buy sugar, rice, wheat, barley, corn, wool, dyes, sweaters and pants. Some of the women’s dreams are to own their own homes, to buy plots of land, to open stores in their homes, to export their products, and for their children to grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow El Banco Comunal Nuevo Día inicia su cuarto ciclo con 17 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, ropa, cereales, abarrotes, artesanía, libros, y servicios D. cosmetología. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente, D. casa en casa y en mercados.

Es el caso D. Miriam que es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Miriam es artesana y realiza trabajos diversos como retablos y tejidos en alpaca, actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. sus hermanas sus ventas los realiza en su misma casa, Miriam con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara lana y pinturas.

Mientras que Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hija, Lourdes tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado para lo cual cuenta con L. ayuda D. su hermana y 1 cocinero, actividad que realiza todos los días. Lourdes con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar azúcar y arroz.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles y 800 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,800 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz, trigo, cebada, maiz, lana, tintes, chompas, pantalones. Los sueños D. las socias es tener casa propia, comprar un terreno, tener una bodega en su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales y exportar sus productos.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, wheat, barley, corn, wool, dyes, sweaters and pants

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El productor Angel solicita a la intitución de AFODENIC, su primer crédito para compra de ternero desarrollo, requiere aumentar su inventario del hato ganadero,de esta forma poder aportar al desarrollo de la económia del pais y mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia, este señor trabaja en las actividades agricola y ganadera en compañia  de sus 4 hijas,  es un hombre con lideazgo en la comunidad de Villa Alvares de Nueva Guinea, tiene buenas relaciones humanas con las personas que necesitan,  fue recomendado por lideres de la comarca, por su comportamiento, este cliente necesita de apoyo de la institución para continuar mejorando sus condicones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Farmer Angel is asking the AFODENIC institution for his first credit in order to purchase a calf to rear: he needs to increase the inventory of his livestock herd, as in this way he can contribute to the economic development of his country and improve his family's living conditions. This gentleman works in agricultural activities and livestock rearing in the company of his four daughters. He is a man with leadership qualities in the community of Villa Alvares in New Guinea. He has good working relations with all the people necessary, and has been recommended by regional leaders for his good character, this client needs the help of the institution to continue improving the conditions of his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calf to rear

loans.name: Edalia

texts.es: Edalia tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus  6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida al paso en una esquina cercana a su casa, su platillo se llama anticuchos (son como brochetas de corazón de res y papa), vende todas las tardes, incluyendo los domingos, y sus vecinos que ya conocen de su buena sazón acuden a ella diariamente para consumir este rico platillo. Su principal herramienta de trabajo es su parrilla, es fácil de transportar y así sale todas las tardes con los ingredientes preparados para tal fin. A Edalia, esta actividad le permite obtener ganancias en poco tiempo y no desatender a sus pequeños. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Esta vez Edalia solicita esta cantidad para invertir en la compra de los ingredientes para los anticuchos, además iniciará otro negocio, transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual adquirirá un motocarro.
texts.en:
Edalia, 36, lives with her husband and their 6 children. She sells fast food on a corner near her house, the dish she sells is called "anticuchos", which are like a kebab of beef heart and potatoes. She sells every afternoon, including Sundays, and her neighbors who already know her excellent flavorings come to her every day to eat this rich snack. Her main working tool is her grill, which is easy to transport, so she goes out every afternoon with the prepared ingredients for this purpose. This work enables Edalia to earn money in a short time without neglecting her little ones. This is her second loan through MFP, and she has repaid punctually. This time Edalia is requesting this loan to purchase the ingredients for the anticuchos, and in addition she will start another business, carrying passengers, for which she will acquire a motorcycle cart.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for her anticuchos, as well as invest in another business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells yams at wholesale and retail. She started this business in 2005. Victoria hopes to expand her yam business. She needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja de manera independiente en las ferias comerciales donde vende zapatos, esta actividad la inició hace más de 10 años, comenzó con poco capital, y ahora le es muy beneficioso, surgió con mucho empeño y supo salir adelante desde cero, además Edith ofrece su calzado a precios módicos, y en un futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de zapatos, por ahora sigue adelante con mucho ahínco por el bien de su familia. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que está comprometida a cumplir a cabalidad con sus cuotas de crédito. En esta ocasión, el dinero será invertido para incrementar su capital de trabajo, es decir sus zapatos, de esta manera abastecer las ventas para esta navidad
texts.en:
Edith is 31 years old, and she lives with her husband and their two children. She works independently at the commercial markets where she sells shoes. She began this activity more than 10 years ago, starting with little capital, and now it is very beneficial, it has surged forward due to her considerable efforts: she knew how to move forward having started with nothing. Also, Edith offers her shoes at moderate prices, and in the future she would like to have a shoe shop; for now she carries on eagerly for the sake of her family. It is the first time she has asked for a load with MFP, for which she is committed to completely fulfil her credit instalment obligations. This time, the money will be invested in order to increase her work capital, that is to say her shoes, as this will allow her to meet demand for this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of shoes she sells

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sr. Lucia tiene 58 años de edad, habitante del barrio 380, casada su esposo trabaja como taxista lo cual es trabajo agotador ya que anda por toda la ciudad en la capital de Managua, y a veces la gente no quiere tomar el servicio de taxi, por que andan con el dinero completo, pero es una ayuda económica mas para la casa. Sus planes es crear un futuro mejor económico y social para sus hijos, 
Doña  lucia se desempeña como auxiliar de enfermería desde hace doce años de experiencia laboral y vendedora de cosmético, zapatos, ropa y prendas inicio su negocio con ingreso propios ya son ocho años en el campo de venta lo cuales son de crecimiento y aumento de utilidad. Sus metas en corto plazo es la construcción de su casa, unos detalles en su cocina asegurando a su familia.  
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra la compra los materiales para la culminación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old. She lives in the 380 neighborhood. Her husband works as a taxi driver, a very exhausting job traveling around the entire city of Managua. It is sometimes hard to find clients as people don’t want to that a cab because they don’t have enough money, but the job still helps support their home economy. Their long term plan is to create a better economic and social environment for their children. Lucia has worked as an auxiliary nurse for twelve years, but she also sells cosmetics, shoes and clothes. She started her business out of her own money eight years ago, and it has been growing since then, having a very positive impact on her home economy. Her short term goal is to make home improvements, especially in the kitchen so her family can be more comfortable. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans, she will be able to purchase construction material to finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material for home improvements

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Hace 2 años decidió tener un restaurante, antes vendía de manera ambulante los platos típicos de su zona, entonces, notó que la mejor manera de  tener mejores ventas era ofreciendo su comida en un local seguro y agradable, cada día trabajaba preparando sus exquisitos platos, pero el problema surgió con el alza de precios   de los alimentos de primera necesidad, no le alcanzó el dinero y tuvo que cerrar temporalmente, pero Flor no se rinde pues en estos próximos días reabrirá su restaurante, y está con muchas ganas de emprender nuevamente su negocio. Es la sexta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha sido muy responsable en la devolución de su préstamo. Con este dinero comprará más mesas, así como cajas de gaseosa para implementar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Flor is 25 years old, she lives with her husband and her son. 2 years ago she decided to set up a restaurant, she had been selling the typical local dishes as a street vendor, as she noticed that the best way of improving sales was to offer her food from safe and pleasant premises. Daily she prepared delicious dishes, but her problems started when costs went up and the money was not sufficient to buy the primary ingredients and she had to close temporarily.But Flor did not give up and soon she will reopen her restaurant and she is very enthusiastic about initiating her business again. This is the sixth time she requests a loan with MFP and she has been very responsible with the repayments of her loans. With this loan she will purchase more tables as well as boxes of soft drinks for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and beverages for a restaurant

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: A married man with five kids who are all currently in school, Stephen M. is 60 years old. He sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, and maize in the local market of New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi where he lives with his family.  He also supplies area boarding schools with ingredients to prepare meals for the students. He has been in business for the past eight years. Stephen is an achiever and stays focused on saving enough to provide his kids with a quality education. He plans to use this loan to buy stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and so forth. Stephen wants to increase his stock so that he could more easily spend the Christmas holiday with his family. He is a member of the community group called Adom bi Apea Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. He will be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 28 years old and married with a child. She specializes in sewing women's clothes and she also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She is a LAPO client. Francisca needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She is grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank. Teofila is 77 years old and married with six children. She has a stand in the F. Vivanco market, where she sells a variety of traditional and non-traditional clothing. She and her daughter also rent out different costumes. Teofila needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy hats and shirts for Carnaval. Teofila’s dreams are to improve her business and have more investment capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras.

Teofila es casada, tiene 77 años y 6 hijos, Teofila tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. ropa típica y también variada, además junto a su hija se dedican al alquiler D. disfraces diversos.

Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. sombrero, blusas para carnavales.

Los sueños D. Teofila son mejorar su negocio y ampliar su capital.

loans.use: Buy Carnaval hats and shirts to sell

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid tiene 42 años, es soltera y vive con su hijo. Lleva trabajando en servicios fotográficos desde hace 18 años, comenzó motivada por la necesidad de brindar a su pequeño el sustento necesario. Se inicio trabajando de manera dependiente en el  estudio fotográfico de su cuñada, después se independizó y ahora está muy contenta por esa decisión. La atención que ella brinda es de lunes a sábado durante todo el día. Es la primera vez que Ingrid solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero será invertido en al compra de una impresora fotográfica, que sin duda facilitará la producción de mayor cantidad de fotografías.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 42 years old, single and lives with her son. She has been working in photographic services since she was 18 years old; she started out in an effort to provide for her son. She began working at her sister-in-law's photography studio, then she started her own business, a decision she is very happy to have taken. She works all day from Monday through Saturday. This is the first time Ingrid has requested a loan from MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. She will use the money to buy a photo printer, which will help her produce a larger quantity of photos.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a photo printer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank.  Esther is 38 years old and married with two children. She has a stand in the April 12 Market, where she sells grains. She buys the grains in markets, and sometimes buys them from the producers themselves. She also has a car, which she rents out to a driver, who uses it as a shared taxi between Ayacucho and Socos.  

Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy wheat, barley and broad beans.  Esther’s dreams are to build a house and to increase the chances that her daughter can have a more opportunity-filled life than her own.

loans.use: To buy broad beans, wheat and barley

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 3 años, con la que obtiene ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, ella contrata a una persona para la atención, debido a que ella es profesora y permanece en el colegio durante el día, lo que no le permite atender ella misma su tienda. Karina está ahora muy animada para hacer crecer su negocio y lograr convertirlo en un minimarket. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Karina solicita esta cantidad para invertirla netamente en mercadería no perecible para su bodega.
texts.en:
Karina is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their two small children. She has had a grocery store for three years and it provides extra income to maintain her family; because she is a teacher and spends all day at school, she employs a person to attend to the store.

Karina is very keen to expand the shop to convert it into a mini-mart. This is her third loan from MFP; she puntually repaid her previous loans.

Karina will use the entire amount of the loan to buy non-perishable goods for her store.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Rose has been in this business for a long time.  Rose is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina O. is a hard-working businesswoman. She is 37 years old and married with four children who are still in school. She trades in fresh eggs. She purchases her supply of eggs from the poultry farmers and retails them to her customers. She enjoys her trade very much but she says prices of commodities and transport cost have gone up due to the current fuel crisis and she has to travel to Kumasi to buy the eggs. Thus, her working capital is insufficient to purchase enough stock. Georgina cooks some of the eggs with pepper and sells them at the road side of Obuasi. A boiled egg with pepper is very delicious, and this is what she has done for the past six years in taking care of her family.

With this loan, Georgina plans to inject additional capital into her business to enable her meet the demands of the market. She plans to use the loan to buy increased stock of eggs, pepper, oil and firewood to increase her profit. Georgina hopes to mobilize more savings to pay for her children's educational fees. She is a member of the community group called Kingdom Trust Group through which she has health insurance. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of fresh eggs, pepper, onions, and other supplies

loans.name: Lisette

texts.es: Lisette tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a las labores de la panadería desde hace 5 años, debido a que su esposo se dedica a esta labor, y llevan de manera conjunta el proceso de la preparación de los panes. Luego de terminados son comercializados en las bodegas y también ellos mismos venden directamente en las principales calles de su localidad, esto se da en la mañanas, luego Lisette contabiliza la venta para ver las ganancias. Esta pareja trabaja arduamente que sus pequeños hijos puedan tener lo necesario para su sustento. Es el tercer préstamo que tiene Lisette con MFP, y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará sacos de harina, además una parte la usará para tramitar la titulación de su profesión como docente.
texts.en:
Lisette is 29 years old; she lives with her husband and their 2 children. She has been a baker for 5 years, since that is her husband's profession; they make the bread together.

The bread is sold in shops and they also sell loaves directly in the town's main streets during the morning; later Lisette keeps the books.

The couple work hard to ensure that their young children will have everything they need. This is Lisette's third loan from MFP; she has shown herself to be responsible in meeting her payments.

She will use the loan to buy sacks of flour, and part will be used by Lisette to obtain her qualification as a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour for her bakery

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank.  Guadalupe is 50 years old and married with three children. Guadalupe sells clothing by special order. She sells on credit to her friends, family members, and institutions. She also rents out dresses for weddings and parties from her home.  

Guadalupe is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy both pants and shirts.  Guadalupe’s dreams are for her children to finish school and to build a house in Lima.

loans.use: To buy pants and shirts

loans.name: Ufuoma

texts.en: Ufuoma O. owns a store where she sells bags of rice and beans, wholesale and retail. She travels to Lagos State to purchase her bags of rice and beans to sell in Benin City. She has been in this business since 2005. She needs the loan amount of N60, 000 to purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Rayda

texts.en:
Rayda is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank.  Rayda is 22 years old and lives with her boyfriend; she doesn’t have any children yet. Rayda has a small store in her home where she works seven days a week selling vegetables, fruits, dry goods and office supplies. Last year, she used to sell ceviche (raw fish cured with lime juice), but stopped because she was not earning very much money.  

Rayda needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rice, sugar and oil.  Rayda dreams of expanding her business, opening a large commercial store, and making the last payment on the land she is buying.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres. Ella es una joven con muchos deseos de triunfar, es por ello que administra su propio negocio, tiene un estudio fotográfico, por el cual se siente satisfecha, son más de 8 años que tiene de experiencia en este negocio, lo que le permite disponer de sus propios ingresos, ella ahora sueña con crecer y mejorar con este servicio  que ofrece, por lo que permanece con el deseo de seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus padres ancianos. Es la primera vez que Luz solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ella se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas de crédito. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de una cámara digital que mejore la producción de sus fotografías.
texts.en:
Luz is 21; she lives with her parents. She has her own business, a photographic studio, and she is a very keen entrepreneur. She has been in the business for over 8 years. It provides her with her own income.

Now she wants to expand and improve the service she offers, the goal being to be able to continue working so as to support her elderly parents.

This is the first time that Luz has asked for a loan from MPF. She undertakes to pay the instalments punctually. She will use the money to buy a digital camera so as to improve the photo production process.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a digital camera

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en: Saturday O. is 35 years old and married with 4 children. He sells provisions and drinks. He and his family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: Margoth tiene 28  años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde su niñez ha conocido lo que es trabajar en las actividades de la panadería, y hoy es su fuente de trabajo, cada día trabaja en este negocio que le permite solventar sus gastos.  Margota es muy dedicada en la preparación de los panes, conoce a la perfección cada parte del proceso para obtener deliciosos panes. Y diariamente también, ella misma comercializa su producto, ha notado que en estos últimos meses ha mejorado su venta, eso le trae satisfacción y le da mas ánimos de seguir adelante. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha sido muy responsable en la devolución de su préstamo. Margoth solicita este dinero para adquirir sacos de harina al por mayor, así como también comprar manteca en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Margoth, 28, lives with her husband and their children. Since she a child, Margoth worked in a bakery and now this is her business, which allows her to supplement her family's income. Margoth works hard in preparing and baking bread; she knows perfectly each step in the baking process. And she also distributes and sells the bread herself. In the last few months, sales have increased, which brings her satifaction and motivates her to work even harder. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP; she paid back the first loan in a very responsible manner. Margoth will use this loan to buy four sacks wholesale, and to buy a large amount of shortening.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing flour and shortening for bakery

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank.  Ana is 30 years old and single; she lives in a rented home. Ana has a call center, located in a rented space on a fairly busy street. She has three phone booths and also sells calling cards and prepaid cell phone cards.  

Ana is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy additional calling cards. Ana dreams of expanding her business, opening another location and earning a technical degree at a local institution.

loans.use: To buy additional phone cards to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María vive con su esposo y sus hijos. DesD. hace más D. 2 años se dedica a L. venta D. ropa, viaja a otras ciudades para adquirirL. y luego las reparte a sus clientes al crédito, solo a personas D. confianza, porque muchas veces, anteriormente, no cumplieron con su acuerdo D. crédito y debido a esa experiencia María trabaja con mayor prudencia y con deseos D. seguir creciendo. Su meta es tener un stand D. venta estable, que le permita manejar un capital considerable D. trabajo. Adicionalmente está analizando L. probabilidad D. asociarse con otra persona para el negocio D. L. venta D. comida. Pero por ahora está avocada en su negocio D. venta D. prendas D. vestir. Es L. primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual con sus pagos. María invertirá en L. compra D. más prendas D. vestir, al por mayor, y aprovechar esta época naviD.ña para lograr incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and their children. For more than 2 years, she's maD. a living selling clothes, travelling to other cities to buy them and then selling them to her customers on credit. She only sells to people that she can trust because she often had trouble before with customers who bought on credit and didn't pay. Because of her experience, Maria is more prudent now. Her goal is to set up a space where she can sell her goods, something that would allow her to better manage her business. She's also examining the possibility of setting up a food business with another person. For now, though, she's committed to selling clothes. This is the first time she's applied for an MFP loan and she's promised to make every payment on time. Maria will use the loan to buy clothes in bulk so that she can increase her sales during the upcoming Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 3 años vio la pronta necesidad de cubrir varias de las necesidades de su hogar, y a pesar de que su esposo trabajaba, muchas veces ese sueldo no era suficiente, por lo cual Maribel decidió asociarse con su hermana para obtener ingresos con un estudio fotográfico, arrendaron un espacio y lo habilitaron para su negocio. De esa manera, acude todas las tardes, después de atender a sus hijos, a su pequeño stand para dedicarse a la toma de fotografías, con siempre la mentalidad de adquirir nuevos clientes, hasta el momento sus ganancias son satisfactorias y tiene todos los deseos de continuar con este negocio. Es la primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete ha trabajar y ser puntual en sus pagos. Invertirá esta cantidad de dinero en la compra de una cámara digital que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maribel lives with her husband and their 3 children. More than 3 years ago, she faced an immediate need to pay some household expenses that her husband's income, even though he was working, couldn't cover. She decided to set up a photography studio with her sister, renting a space and renovating it for the business. She goes there every afternoon after tending to her children. It's a small stand where she can earn money taking photographs and she's always searching for new customers. Earnings have been satisfactory up to now and she hopes to continue the business. This is the first time she's applied for an MFP loan and she promises to make all her payments on time. She will use the loan to buy a digital camera so that she can improve the quality of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a digital camera for photography business.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus O. is 45 years old and married with 6 children. He sells building paint of different colours. He has been in this business for a long time. The demand for his building paint is high, and he hopes to meet the needs of his customers. He needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more building paints to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more building paint to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is married and a father of five children. He is the local producer of polythene (plastic) bags for the past ten years; he also sells bags of salt for cooking and ice cream--this is a business he recently established in his community based on the demand. Samuel is a young man with a vision to serve humanity with his talent and skills. He dreams of running a well-established company of his own that produces polythene bags to serve all kinds of purposes. He supplies food vendors, market sellers and supermarkets with his bags. Samuel is currently unable to produce on a large scale to meet the demands of his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy large quantity of plastic and another machine to facilitate his production to meet demand. He belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy another machine and polythene to make plastic bags

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank. Serafina is 63 years old and widowed with seven children, two of whom still live with her. Serafina has a stand in the Santa Clara Market, where she sells a variety of prepared meals. On a daily basis, she works from 6am to 6pm. She also owns two motorcycle taxis, of which her two sons drive.  

Serafina is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice, pasta and potatoes. Serafina dreams of improving her business so that she can improve the lives of her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta and potatoes

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank.   Teresa is 45 years old and married with three children. Teresa sells cheese from door to door; sometimes she also sells on credit. She buys the cheese in the town of Alpachaca, and sometimes buys milk to make the cheese herself.  

Teresa is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy a stove.  Teresa dreams of building her own home, improving her business and providing her children with a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a stove to increase cheese production

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She sells cooked foods like rice, beans, plantains, yams, etc. The demand for her cooked foods is high. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Trabaja cada día para en pro de la mejora de su panadería, ella elabora sus propios panes en un horno artesanal. Su trabajo diario consiste en levantarse muy temprano para la preparación y venta de sus panes. Es un proceso complejo que va desde calentar su horno con leña, tamizar la harina hacer la mezcla, batir manualmente, bolear, controlar el tiempo de cocción del pan y contabilizar la cantidad de producción. Para Nancy la época de mayor venta es cuando comienza el año escolar (marzo – abril). En el futuro quiere implementar su panadería con maquinarias modernas, como una batidora y mezcladora. El esfuerzo de Nancy es motivado por sus hijos. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y demostró en el anterior ciclo ser una persona puntual con sus créditos. Esta vez invertirá en la compra de sacos de harina y leña para su horno, comprará en grandes cantidades, lo almacenará para que el alza de precios no afecte sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nancy, 31, lives with her husband and young son. She works hard at her small bakery, making bread in a traditional oven. Her day starts early in the morning so that she has time to make her bread and sell it. It's a complex process, heating the wood oven, sifting flour for the mix, beating the dough, rolling it, controlling the cooking time, etc. Nancy's strongest sales are at the beginning of the school year (March, April). In the future, she wants to set up a bakery with modern equipment. Nancy's motivation to work hard is her children. This is the third time that she's applied to MFP for a loan and she's show herself to be punctual in repaying past loans. She will use the loan to buy sacks of flour and wood for her oven. She will buy large quanitities of supplies and stock them so that price increases don't affect her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank. She is 48 years old and married with three children. She travels to different regional markets twice a week to buy grains and animals (such as cows, pigs and goats) to bring to the city of Ayacucho. There, she resells the items at the San Juan Bautista Market.  

Sabina is requesting a loan of 1600 soles to buy animals.  Sabina’s dreams are to increase her investment capital, to improve her business, and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase animals to increase her sales inventory at the San Juan Batista Market

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank.  Graciela is 41 years old and married with three children. She lives in the Chiara district, located an hour from the city of Ayacucho, where she runs a store selling dry goods, fruits, and vegetables. She works everyday at her store, and also works at the civil registry of the Chiara Municipality. 

At this time, Graciela is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy fruitcake and milk. Graciela dreams of educating her children so that they grow up to be working professionals, owning more investment capital, and finishing construction on her house in the city of Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy fruitcake and milk for her store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice E. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are currently in school. She has been manufacturing of palm oil for four years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. She produces the oil and supplies it to food vendors who use it to prepare their wares. She plans to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, containers to store the oil, and an electric milling machine to allow her to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Kingdom Trust Group; her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral and help one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and an electric milling machine for making palm oil

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia tiene 48 años, vive con su hijo de 12 años. Ha trabajado desde hace 3 años a diversos negocios, según la ocasión, y desde hace un año se dedica a prestar dinero a sus vecinos, por este servicio cobra un porcentaje de devolución, que es su ganancia, es por ello que Octavia tiene un cuaderno de registros de sus prestamos (que se muestra en la foto) para tener un control detallados de ellos, para Octavia, esta es una buena opción para salir adelante, ya que no quiere descuidar la atención de su hijo de 12 años y esta actividad le permite estar con su hijo. Es la segunda vez que sólita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Con esta cantidad podrá  incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Octavia is 48 years old, and lives with her 12-year old son. Over the past 3 years, she has worked in various businesses depending on the occasion, and for the past year, she has focused on lending money to her neighbors. She charges a percentage fee for this service, which is her earnings. Octavia keeps a notebook in which to record her loans (shown in the photo) and maintain detailed control of them. For Octavia, this is a good chance to move ahead, as she does not want to neglect her son, and this work allows them to be together. This is the second time that Octavia is soliciting a loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and has demonstrated punctuality in her previous payments. With this loan, Octavia will be able to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She and her family live in Benin city, in Edo state, Nigeria. She sells crates of drinks in either wholesale lots or at retail, to her customers. Joy is requesting the loan amount of N102, 000 to purchase additional supplies of drinks for resale. She says thank you to all those who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of drinks for resale

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is 60 years old, and she is divorced with 2 children. She sells gravel. The demand for her gravel is high and she hopes to meet the needs of her customers. Lillian needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more gravel to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase gravel to sell

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene tiene 36 años y vive con sus 2 hijos. Ella tiene una botica desde hace 6 años, abrió este negocio debido a que estudió la carrera técnica de farmacia y sus deseos de ejercer su profesión la motivaron a  tener esta fuente de ingreso. Cada día atiende a sus clientes, sobre todo en las mañanas, por las tardes atiende a sus hijos, para Rene, esta actividad es una  buena opción como fuente de ingresos, ahora tiene grandes expectativas de seguir con este negocio, y una de ellas es abrir una sucursal. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y en el primer ciclo fue puntual en sus pagos. Esta cantidad será invertida en la compra de mercadería, es decir los medicamentos que usualmente comercializa en su botica
texts.en:
Rene is 36 years old and lives with her 2 children. For the past 6 years she has run a drugstore, which she opened because of her technical career in pharmacy studies, and her professional desire motivated her to create this source of income. She serves clients daily - especially in the mornings - and in the afternoons she looks after her children. This work is a good source of income for Rene, and she eagerly expects to continue with her drugstore, hoping to eventually open a branch. This is the second time Rene is asking for a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she was punctual with her first loan's payments. This amount will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, such as drugs that she usually sells at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicine for her drugstore

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío tiene 27 años y vive con sus padres. Es una joven que ha decidió solventar sus estudios universitarios generándose sus propios recursos, para ello tiene una tienda de abarrotes que instaló en su propia casa, atendiendo generalmente por las tardes y los fines de semana todo el día, ya que por la mañanas está estudiando. Rocío siempre está al pendiente de sus productos para tener surtida su tienda, también vende cerveza, que es lo que le genera más ganancias. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y demostró ser muy responsable en su primer crédito. Con el dinero que pide incrementará la mercadería de su bodega, y aprovechará las fiestas navideñas para las ventas que está programando.
texts.en:
Rocio, 27, lives with her parents. She's a young woman who has decided to work her way through school, generating income with a grocery business to pay her university fees. She set up the business in a room at her house, tending to it in the afternoons during the week and all day on weekends. She goes to school mornings during the week. Rocio is always on the lookout for products to stock her store. She also sells beer, the product that generates the greatest earnings for her. This is her second MFP loan and she showed herself to be very responsible in repaying the first one. With the loan, she will buy merchandise for her store and make the most of the increased demand that she expects around Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank. Aquilina is 25 years old and lives with her partner and their son in the Chiara district. She has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, fruits, clothing and sneakers. She works at her store seven days a week, and also farms potatoes, which she sells in the Chiara market.  

At this time, Aquilina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, milk and rice. Aquilina dreams of buying a car to transport her wares and improving her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and milk

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three kids; two of them attend school. She prepares and sells local foods like banku, which is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to pay her costs. With the loan, she plans to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare meals. He would be grateful for this assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making food for his restaurant

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet has a shop in Benin City where she sells provisions and drinks. Juliet is 24 years and married with 4 children. Juliet hopes to meet the needs of her customers during this festive season. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Maximiliana Tomasa

texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank.  Maximiliana is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. Maximiliana regularly travels to regional markets to buy grains and animals. She sells these products in the markets around the city of Ayacucho. Maximiliana and her husband also have a car, which they use as a taxicab between the towns of Ayacucho and Chiara (about one hour away). 

Maximiliana is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy a variety of grains. Maximiliana dreams of buying a motorcycle taxi for her son to drive and launching a business selling dry goods.

loans.use: To buy grains to sell at markets

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres. Trabaja cada día en un centro de llamadas público, para cubrir sus gastos de estudio, y además ayudar en su casa, además, también vende tarjetas prepago de telefonía celular y chips. Su negocio le ha traído la satisfacción de salir adelante, cumpliendo así un año de constantes esfuerzos, para que pueda tener en el futuro una economía estable. Es la primera vez que Rosa está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con esta cantidad comprará en grandes cantidades de chips y tarjetas prepago de la misma empresa de telefonía.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 and lives with her parents. She works each day in the public call center to cover her student expenses and she also helps in the house, also she sells prepaid cell phone cards and chips. Her business has brought her the satisfaction of moving forward, completing like this one year of constant strengths, so that she can have in the future a stable economic situation. This is the first time that Rosa is asking for a loan with MFP, so she promises to be very responsible with her payments. With this quantity she will buy in large quantities the prepaid cards and chips from the same phone factory.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying prepaid cell phone cards

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 55 years old and has 7 children. She bakes cakes, meat pies, etc. Florence is a LAPO client.  She needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more baking materials to bake more snacks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 20 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de los ganado desde hace 2 años cuando decidió formar una familia junto a su esposo, desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar incesantemente  para lograr los ingresos necesarios. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de animales y luego revenderlos los fines de semana en las principales ferias ganaderas, y cuando a veces le quedan uno o dos animales que no logró vender, los lleva al establo que implementó en su casa. Adicionalmente a ello, Rosario le ayuda a su esposo en su taller de tapicería, el cual también es una fuente de ingreso importante para su familia, Rosario sueña con tener mayor cantidad de ganado, para vender mucho más, siempre está motivada por darles a sus pequeños hijos lo mejor, sobre todo en sus gastos escolares. Es la  primera vez que Rosario solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada por los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, porque conocen que es una persona responsable. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de un toro más que pueda vender.
texts.en:
Rosario is 20 years old and lives with her husband and her 2 children. She is dedicated to the sale of livestock since two years ago when she decided to form a family together with her husband, since thens he has not stopped incessantly working to achieve the necessary income. Her work consists of buying animals and later reselling them on the weekend in the major fairs and markets, and when, sometimes she still has one or two animals that didn't sell, she brings them to the stable at her house. In addition to that, Rosario helps her husband in his upholstry workshp, which is also an important source of income for her family. Rosario dreams of having a larger quantity of livestock, to sell much more, she is always motivated to give her childen the best, above all in their education expenses, they know she is a responsible person. She will invest the money in the purchase of another bull which she can sell. It is the first tome that Rosaria has asked for a loan with MFP, she was invited by the other members of her community bank, Porquder.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un toro

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Alondras (“Larks”) Village Bank. Eulalia is 46 years old and married with four children. Eulalia has a stand in the Nery Garcia Market where she sells a variety of bread, which she buys from local bakeries. Eulalia also sells homemade gelatin desserts; she sells both bread and gelatin seven days a week.  

Now, Eulalia is in need of a loan of 1000 soles to buy fruitcakes for the Christmas season. Eulalia dreams of improving her house and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy fruitcake to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Alondras (“Larks”) Village Bank. Lucia is 29 years old and married with three children. Lucia travels to regional fairs to buy livestock - such as cattle, pigs and hens. She sells the animals at the San Juan Sunday Market. Sometimes, she kills the animals herself and sells the meat wholesale to butcher shops. 

Lucia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy rams. Lucia’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build a house on and to support her children until they become working professionals.

loans.use: To buy rams so she can resell them to butcher shops at fairs across the city.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Doris molds and sells traditional clay pots. After molding the clay pots, she takes the clay pots to the local market to sell. She hopes to expand this business by meeting the needs of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more clay to produce more traditional clay pots. Doris says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clay to produce more clay pots

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde O. is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Kehinde has a shop where she sells bean cakes, normally called "akara" in Nigeria. She also sells bread. Kehinde needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more bags of beans and bread. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans and bread

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Alondras (“Larks”) Village Bank. Fortunata is 56 years old and married with seven children. Fortunata owns a plot of land in the Totora community, located fifteen minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho, where she grows different vegetables (depending on the season) with the help of her husband and children. She sells the vegetables in the Ayacucho Abastos Market.

Fortunata needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy seeds and medicine. Fortunata dreams of improving her house and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras. Fortunata es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Fortunata tiene sus terrenos en la comunidad D. Totora que se ubica a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. produce verduras variadas dependiendo D. la época, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Fortunata necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. semillas y remedios. Fortunata sueña con mejorar su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy seeds and medicine

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel V. está muy agradecido con todos ustedes por el gran apoyo que recibió en el préstamo anterior. Su negocio ha crecido bastante y ha podido darles trabajo a dos personas más.
Está solicitando su colaboración para invertir ahora en la compra y venta de aparatos. Su idea es seguir desarrollándose y con este nuevo propósito de comercialización, no tiene duda que lo logrará.
Corresponde a cada uno de ustedes que le brindarán su apoyo para este nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel V. is very thankful for all of you and the great support that he received in his previous loan. His business has grown considerably and he has been able to give work to two more people. He is requesting your collaboration to invest now in the purchase and sales of air conditioners and heaters. His idea is to continue developing and with this new commercialization plan, he has no doubt that he will achieve it. He will repay each of you who offers your support to him in this new project.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (air conditioners and heaters)

loans.name: Xenia

texts.es: Xenia tiene 34 años, vive con sus padres. Ella es docente de profesión, y esto no fue dificultad para que inicie un negocio propio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo, sus productos los que ofrece principalmente a sus colegas de trabajo, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años, cuando unas amistades le hicieron la propuesta sobre este negocio. En la actualidad, Xenia trabaja incansablemente para seguir adelante y acrecentar su capital de trabajo, ya que disfruta mucho de esta labor. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y es una de las clientas más puntuales de su banco comunal. Xenia solicita esta cantidad que invertirá en la compra de más productos y cancelarlos al contado, lo que le permitirá a ella vender al crédito.
texts.en:
Xenia, 34, lives with her parents. She is a teacher by profession. She operates a business buying cosmetics from catalogs and reselling them to her customers, most of whom are work colleagues. She started the business 2 years ago after some friends suggested the idea to her. Xenia works tirelessly these days to get ahead and add to the value of her business because she enjoys the work very much. This is the third time that she's applied to MFP for a loan and she's one of her community bank's most punctual clients. Xenia will use the loan to buy more products and pay her account in cash, something that will allow her to sell on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Magda

texts.en:
Magda is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank. Magda is a 42-year-old single mother with two children. Magda sells clothing by special order to her friends, family members, and institutions. She buys the clothes in Lima and Tacna. She also sells natural products and cosmetics from a catalog. Magda needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy natural products. Magda dreams of having a store in her home and of improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Magda es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. Magda es madre soltera, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Magda vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares e instituciones, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y Tacna. Además Magda vende productos naturales y cosméticos por catálogos.

Magda necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos naturales. Magda sueña con tener una bodega en su casa y mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Buy natural products for re-sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 50 years old, and she is a widow with 7 children. She sells bread. She has been in this business for a long time. Elizabeth needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Blanca Mamerta

texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.   Blanca is 50 years old and separated; she has four children. Blanca has a stand in the April 12th Market, where she sells children’s clothing and traditional Ayacuchan clothing that she sews herself. She also travels to different regional fairs twice a week to sell her clothes.  Blanca needs a loan of 1050 PEN to buy baby clothing.  Blanca hopes that her business will grow.  

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
