Blanca es separada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Blanca tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. ropa D. niños y ropa típica ayacuchana que elL. misma confecciona, además viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región 2 veces por semana donD. también venD. ropa. 
Blanca necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ropa D. bebe. 
Blanca espera que su negocio se amplié.

loans.use: Buy baby clothes

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.  Angelica is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Angelica sells earrings and accessories to her friends and family members. She and her mother also run a dry goods store from their home.  Angelica needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy fruitcake and wine.  Angelica dreams of owning her own home, having a motorcycle, and expanding her business. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Angelica es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. 
Angelica es  soltera, tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres, Angélica vende aretes, accesorios que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, Además junto a su mama tienen una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. 
Angelica necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, vinos. 
Angelica sueña con tener una casa propia, una moto y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake and wine

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 24 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años llamado Andre. Se dedica a realizar transporte de pasajeros con su motocarro, contrató a un joven como chofer, y le paga un sueldo fijo. Ha venido dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 3 años, siendo muy rentable, ya que la demanda por este servicio es abundante. Lo difícil de su trabajo es tener que lidiar con las averías de la moto que al trabajar tanto se va desgastando, pero a pesar de estos inconvenientes ella sabe que si le pone muchas ganas y mucho empeño logrará salir adelante por el bienestar de su pequeño Andre. Doris se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su motocarro para lograr mayor efectividad en el transporte y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Doris is 24 years old, the single mother of a 3-year-old son named Andre. She works organizing passenger transport in her motorcycle cab. She has hired a young man as a driver and pays him a salary. She has dedicated herself to this enterprise for three years, and has been very successful because there is great demand for the service. The difficult part of her job is struggling with the breakdowns of her motorcycle, which is wearing out from so much use, but despite these problems she knows that with a lot of will and determination she will be able to provide for little Andre's well-being. Doris is requesting her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money requested she will repair her motorcycle cab in order to achieve greater effectiveness in transport and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcycle cab

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
La casa del señor “Lalo”  la adquirió por medio de su trabajo, mediante un crédito de gobierno. Poco a poco ha ido haciendo mejoras benéficas ahora es el turno de impermeabilizar y poner aislante para mantener una buena temperatura en el interior y ahuyentar la humedad. De esta manera salvaguarda la salud y la comodidad de sus dos hijos y su esposa.
Requiere del apoyo de ustedes para lograr su meta, sobre todo en esta temporada fría, estará eternamente agradecido por toda la ayuda que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Eduardo B. V., or “Lalo” purchased his house with hard work, using a government loan. Little by little, he's been making small improvements and now it’s the time to purchase waterproof paint and isolating material for his home to maintain a good inner temperature and to block humidity. This way he will create a healthier and more comfortable environment for his wife and two children. He needs your support to achieve his goal, especially on this cold season. He will be extremely grateful for any help you could give him.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make impervious on his home ceiling

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 34 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con sus hijos; Juan de 14, Daniel de 12, Griselda de 10 y Frank de 2 años. Tras haber laborado en diversos oficios, desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta ambulante de popcorn, para poder solventar los gastos de su familia. La venta de este producto es muy buena, ya que su rico sabor atrae a muchos paladares al puesto de Doris. Lo complicado de su trabajo es preparar el popcorn, de manera artesanal, y dejarlo en su punto, pero Doris tiene buena mano para la preparación y los prepara muy agradables. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mejorar sus ventas, refaccionando su triciclo donde vende su producto, para mejorar la atención al público y producir mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Doris is 34 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her children, Juan (14 years old), Daniel (12), Griselda (10), and Frank (2). After having worked a variety of jobs, she has been working for three years as a popcorn street vendor in order to cover her family's expenses. Sales of the product are excellent, since the delicious flavor attracts many palates to Doris's stand. The complicated part of her job is preparing the popcorn by hand and getting it just right, but Doris has a knack for it and prepares it very well. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to improve her sales with the money requested, refurbishing the cart from which she sells her product in order to better serve her customers and increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish the cart she uses for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.  Teodora is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Teodora has a store, a bar, and a restaurant with a variety of offerings, where she sells different foods during the day. In the afternoons she sells drinks, and also offers photocopying services.  Last month, Teodora bought a plot of land, where she hopes to build a house.  Teodora needs a loan of 2100PEN to buy rice, sugar and fruitcake.  Teodora dreams of building her house, buying a car, expanding her store and offering a wider variety of merchandise.
  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. 
Teodora es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Teodora tiene una tienda, bar y restaurante surtida ubicado en la alameda del cementerio en donde vende abarrotes, además vende comida variada durante el día, por las tardes vende bebidas, también brinda servicio de fotocopiado. En el ultimo mes Teodora compro un terreno y espera construir su casa. 
Teodora necesita un préstamo se 2100 dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, panteón. 
Teodora sueña con construir su casa, ampliar y surtir mas su negocio y comprar un carro.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and fruitcake

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.  Magdalina is 38 years old and married with three children. Magdalina sells fresh-squeezed orange juice from a mobile cart on the street, in the center of the city of Ayacucho, She also sells sweets from the little cart at the same time.  Magdalina needs a loan of 1050PEN to buy chocolate, caramels and soft drinks.  Magdalina’s dreams are for her children to get ahead in life, to improve her business, and to save enough for the future. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Magdalina es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. 
Magdalina es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Magdalena vende jugos de naranja que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza ambulantemente en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además vende golosinas en una carretilla, ambos negocios los realiza en el mismo lugar. 
Magdalina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chocolates, caramelos y gaseosas. 
Los sueños de Magdalina son que sus hijos salgan adelante, su negocio mejore y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.

loans.use: Buy supplies of chocolate, caramels and soft drinks

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Momé Hounkpati, Madame A. Essi est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. C’est une femme très dévouée qui est reconnue dans le milieu pour son dynamisme. Propriétaire de mini restaurant, elle prépare des mets locaux que ses clients apprécient beaucoup. Son problème le plus crucial reste le manque de moyens financiers pour son activité. Pourtant, elle fait preuve d’une bonne capacité de gestion des affaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de redynamiser ses activités, sécuriser ses revenus et améliorer sa qualité de vie.
texts.en:
Born in Mome Houkpati in 1972, Mrs Essi A. is married and the mother of six (06) children. Essi is a very dedicated woman and known in her area as being a dynamic individual. As owner of a mini-restaurent, she prepares local meals that are much appreciated by her customers. Her major problem is the lack of adequate financing for her business. Nevertheless, she has proven to have good business skills. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to revitalize her business, secure her revenues and improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her restaurent

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 35 años, vive solo ya que aun no se ha casado. El posee un triciclo con el cual trabaja diariamente de 7 a 9 de la noche realizando transporte de pasajeros en su ciudad, con ello aumenta sus ingresos y puede sostener sus gastos. Lo que le gusta a Juan de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene al desarrollarlo, ya que le permite desplazarse por diferentes lugares, y conocer gente. Las ganancias son buenas y Juan espera  lograr  mejores ingresos arreglando su triciclo para poder brindar un mejor servicio. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado Juan comprará nuevos asientos para su triciclo, los cuales se rasgaron al trabajar tanto.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old. He lives alone and has never been married. He has a three-wheeled vehicle that he uses daily from 7 to 9 at night, transporting passengers in his city. With this vehicle he is able to increase his earnings and cover his expenses. What Juan likes about his work is the freedom it offers as he develops it, because it allows him to visit different places and meet people. His earnings are good and Juan hopes to increase his income by repairing his vehicle in order to offer better service. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money requested Juan will purchase new seats for his vehicle, as they have become ripped with so much use.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new seats for his three-wheeled vehicle

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: Liduvina tiene 45 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus tres hijos; Yen de 15, Antonia de 11 y Juan Daniel de 8 años. Se dedica a la venta de emoliente, que no es más que un surtido de mates que son benéficos para la salud, lo hace de forma ambulante. Empieza su trabajo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 y luego nuevamente desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, disponiendo de tiempo para velar por sus hijos. Lo bueno de su negocio es que arroja buenas ganancias, ya que Liduvina le pone mucho empeño y dedicación y sale desde muy temprano para ganar más clientela y se recoge tarde para conseguir mejores ganancias. Ella se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mates para elaborar sus bebidas y refaccionar su triciclo comprando nuevas llantas.
texts.en:
Liduvina is 45 years old, separated, and lives with her three children: Yen (15), Antonia (11), and Juan Daniel (8). She is a street vendor who sells medicinal drinks for a living - nothing more than an assortment of infusions with health benefits. She works from 6:00 until 8:00 in the morning, and then later from 6:00 to 9:00 or 10:00 in the evening, which leaves time for her to watch her children. The good part about her business is that it provides good income since Liduvina shows lots of effort and dedication. She leaves the house early to find more customers, and comes home late to make more money. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will purchase a larger supply of infusions for making her remedies and will refurbish her tricycle with new wheels.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger supply of infusions for her preparations

loans.name: Kokou Mawuenyégan

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, Monsieur A. Kokou Mawuenyégan est né à Fiokpo dans la préfecture de Kloto. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il est actuellement domicilié à Kpémé. Il arrive à joindre les deux bouts en s’adonnant au commerce de produits et médicaments génériques. Il est à noter qu’il a une bonne réputation et une bonne maîtrise de la gestion de son activité.
Il sollicite un financement pour l’achat d’autres produits génériques recherchés par sa clientèle. Cela augmentera son chiffre d’affaires, son revenu et lui permettra d’assurer la scolarisation et l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou Mawuenyégan A., 43, was born in Fiokpo in the prefecture of Kloto. Married and the father of 4 children, he presently lives in Kpémé. He manages to make ends meet by selling generic medicines and such. It should be noted that he has a good reputation and a good mastery of the management skills necessary for his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy other generic products his clientele has asked him for. This will increase his turnover and allow him to pay the school fees and assure the future of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of generic medicines

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 27 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus hijas Ágata de 13 y Yesthal de 10. Se dedica a la venta de comida en la ciudad de Juliaca de forma ambulante. Norma le pone gran dedicación a su trabajo, ya que siempre le ha gustado la cocina y su rica sazón atrae a la clientela, que cada vez es mayor, logrando que su negocio sea más rentable. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es adquirir los ingredientes para preparar sus platillos, ya que los precios han subido. Norma se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes e insumos para elaborar sus platillos y así ganar más.
texts.en:
Norma is 27-years-old. She is separated from her partner and lives with her daughters Ágata, 13, and Yesthal, 10. She earns her living selling food as a street vendor in Juliaca. Norma is extremely dedicated to her work, since she has always enjoyed cooking, and her delicious dishes, which get better all the time, attract customers, making her business even more profitable. The most difficult part of her work is obtaining ingredients for her recipes, as prices have gone up. This will be Norma’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to use the money to purchase more ingredients so she can prepare her dishes and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Virtud Group

texts.en:
The Virtud (“Virtue”) Village Bank is starting its 16th loan cycle and has 19 members. The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, including selling fruits, vegetables, cancha (dried, toasted corn), ice cream, tubers, handicrafts, animals, food, clothing, and cheese. Some sell from home or in the marketplace; others sell from door-to-door and on foot.  For example, Haydee is 28 years old and lives with her four children. Haydee sells ice cream from a mobile cart in the Nery Garcia Market.  Sonia is 36 years old and is separated with four children. Sonia has a stand in the F. Vivanco Market, where she works seven days a week selling a variety of fruits.  Alicia is 22 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. She and her husband have an auto repair shop, and in the afternoons she sells prepared meals from the door of their home.  The group members need different loan amounts, ranging from 200 to 1,000 PEN. The group is asking for a total of 7,500 PEN.  They plan to use their loans to buy ice cream, fruit, tires, vegetables, rice, sugar and small animals.  Some of the women’s dreams are to own their own homes, to save enough, to proviD. their children with a good education and to expand their businesses.
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Virtud  inicia su 16 ciclo, con 19 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la frutas, verduras, canchas, helados, tubérculos, artesanía, animales, comida, ropa, quesos. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente, D. casa en casa y en mercados. 
Como es el caso D. Haydee que es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 4 hijos, Haydee venD. helados D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García. 
Por otro lado Sonia es separada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Sonia tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Mientras que Alicia es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Alicia junto a su esposo tienen una vulcanizadora y por las tardes venD. comida en la puerta D. su casa. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 300 soles, 400 soles y 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,500 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. helados, frutas, llantas, verduras, arroz, azúcar, animales menores. 
Los sueños D. las socias es tener casa propia, ahorrar lo suficiente, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Buy supplies of ice cream, fruit, tires, vegetables, rice, sugar and small animals

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 58 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos José de 14 años y Asunción de 13. Se dedica a la venta de cerveza, actividad que viene realizando desde hace ya 12 años para mantener a su familia, la cual es su mayor incentivo, para salir adelante. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo son las ganancias que obtiene de la venta, ya que esto le permite brindarle educación, alimento y los demás gastos que requieren sus pequeños. A Rosa no le resulta difícil su trabajo, pero si muy agotador, debido a que debe permanecer durante varias horas ofreciendo su producto. Rosa quiere salir adelante y por eso requiere de nuestro apoyo para lograr todas sus metas. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 58-year-old single mother who lives with her children José 14, and Asunción, 13. She earns her living by selling beer, which she has been doing for the past 12 years to support her family, her main reason for forging ahead. What she likes about her work are the earnings she gets from her sales, as they allow her provide education, food, and everything else her little ones need. Rosa does not find her work difficult, but it is exhausting since she has to spend quite a few hours at a time selling her product. Rosa would like to get ahead, so she requires our support to achieve all of her goals. This will be her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to use the money to purchase more cases of beer in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo tiene 32 años, es soltero y vive solo. Se dedica  a brindar servicio de transporte en su triciclo con el cual trabaja de 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche, horario en el que hay bastante clientela. Rosendo se viene dedicando a este trabajo desde hace 2 años, en los cuales ha ganado mucha experiencia en este rubro, y le gustaría seguir trabajando para expandir su negocio, en un futuro comprar más triciclos o si se puede un motocarro, para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo difícil de su trabajo es el esfuerzo físico que debe realizar al manejar el triciclo y aunque es joven termina agotado al finalizar el día. Rosendo se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita quiere refaccionar su triciclo y poder brindar un mejor servicio, por ende atraer más clientela.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 32 years old, single, and living alone. He provides public transportation with his tricycle, working from 8 in the morning to 7 or 8 at night, during which times there are the most customers. Rosendo has been doing this work for two years, during which he has gained much experience in this area, and he would like to continue working so that he can expand his business. In the future he would like to buy more tricycles, or, if possible, a car so that he can increase his revenues. The difficult thing about his work is the physical effort that one needs to peddle the tricycle. Although he is young, he ends his days exhausted. Rosendo is asking for his first loan from Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money that he's requesting, he want to refurbish his tricycle and be able to offer a better service to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his tricycle

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Ayni II Village Bank.  Juana is 65 years old and separated, with two children. She has a store on a centrally located street in the city of Ayacucho where she rents wedding dresses, party dresses and suits. She also has a workshop where she sews clothing in the same location. She has several employees who help her sew.  Juana needs a loan of 2500 PEN to buy a variety of fabrics.  Juana dreams of buying more sewing machines for her workshop and of traveling to different places to relax. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni II.
Juana es separada, tiene 65 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde alquila vestidos de novia, de fiesta, ternos, además tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir que esta en el mismo lugar, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas.
Juana sueña con implementar con mas maquinas su taller y viajar a distintos lugares para descansar.

loans.use: Buy a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé en 1961, Madame S. Rose vit seule avec ses trois (03) enfants depuis son divorce avec son mari. Infatigable et très dévouée, elle se débat chaque jour pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. N’arrivant pas à faire face aux énormes difficultés quotidiennes et à bout de souffle, elle s’est adonnée à la vente de bois de chauffe et de résidus de noix de coco très recherchés dans la localité. Mais elle connaît souvent des moments de ruptures et la demande de sa clientèle en bois de chauffe ne cesse d'augmenter.
Pour disposer d’un peu de fonds de roulement et renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un financement destiné à l’achat des bois de chauffe et autres qu’elle va revendre en détail dans son quartier. Ce financement lui permettra de satisfaire ses clients, d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et surtout relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1961, Mrs. Rose S. has been living alone with her three children since her divorce from her husband. Tireless and devoted to her family, she struggles daily to support her children. Since she was not able to come to terms with her enormous daily difficulties and worn down by them, she began selling firewood and coconut residue which is very much in demand in her area. However, she has moments where her stock is expended and her clientele's demand for firewood is continually growing.

In order to have a bit more working capital and bolster her business, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy firewood and such, items she will retail in her neighborhood. This loan will allow her to satisfy the needs of her clientele, grow her sales and, especially, improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and coconut residue for re-sale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Ayni II Village Bank.  Teodora is 45 years old and is married, with seven children. Teodora sells firewood from her home, located in the Libertad neighborhood. She also travels to different regional markets to buy various grains, which she then sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.  Teodora is requesting a loan of 1050 PEN to buy firewood.  Teodora’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her business. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni II. 
Teodora es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Teodora venD. leña en su casa ubicada en el barrio libertad. Además viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales variados y luego lo venD. al por mayor en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 
Teodora necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Los sueños D. Teodora son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Née en 1972 à Gbopémé (Préfecture de Vo), Madame F. Afi est une brave femme qui exerce comme activité la vente des denrées alimentaires (haricot, gari etc).
Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle arrive difficilement à joindre les deux bouts à cause de son revenu très limité. Très souvent confronté à de fréquente rupture de stock, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en en sacs de haricot, de gari et d’huile afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Gbopémé (Vo Prefecture), Mrs. Afi F. is a respectable woman who has been selling foodstuffs such as dried beans, "gari" (cassava flour), etc.

Married and the mother of 3 children, she barely arrives to make ends meet since her income is very limited. Very often she finds her inventory expended, so she is requesting a loan to buy sacks of dried beans, of "gari" (cassava flour), and of oil, so as to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Kloussè Djatougbé

texts.fr:
Cette dame de vingt cinq (25) ans est une femme travailleuse qui exerce dans le commerce de charbons, ce commerce marche bien au Togo, elle s’approvisionne dans le marché local d’Anié. Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 300000f de chez WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé et sans difficultés. Elle sollicite un deuxième prêt pour s’approvisionner avec vingt (20)sacs de charbons.
Elle est divorcée de son époux  KOFFI Yao avec qui elle a eu un enfant, elle pourra à l’aide de ce crédit soutenir sa famille et son enfant
texts.en:
This 25-year-old woman is a hard-working woman who sells charcoal, a trade which is profitable in Togo. She purchases her stock from the local market in Anié. She has already taken out one loan of 300,000 XOF with WAGES which she repaid in full with no problems. She is requesting this second loan so she can purchase 20 sacks of charcoal. She is divorced from her husband Yao Koffi with whom she has one child. With this loan she will be able to support her family and her child.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 37 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos Cristian de 11 y Luz Rosario de 2 añitos. Es una mujer muy empeñosa, se dedica desde hace 6 años, a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Lo que le gusta a Yolanda de su trabajo es la libertad que le brinda, ya que puede decidir en qué horario vender y a qué horas retirarse, sin un jefe del cual depender. Pero la abundancia de clientes que esperan por deleitarse con sus ricos platillos es a veces es muy numeroso, y no puede abastecerse para atenderlos a todos, aún así, Yolanda sabe que esto es señal de que está progresando y es por eso que quiere expandir su negocio. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita Yolanda comprará algunas sillas, utensilios de cocina; como platos cucharas, cucharones, etc., para mejorar la atención en su pequeño puesto.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 37, single, and lives with her children Christian, 11, and Luz Rosario, 2. She is a very hard-working woman, and for the past six years she has made her living as a street vendor selling food. What Yolanda likes about her work is the freedom it allows her, since she can say when she works and when she doesn’t, without having to answer to a boss. But sometimes there are so many customers waiting to enjoy her delicious food that she does not have enough to feed them all. Even so, Yolanda takes this as a sign that she is advancing, which is why she wants to expand her business. This will be her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to use the money to purchase some chairs, along with kitchen implements including plates, spoons, ladles, etc., so she can improve her small stand.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs and utensils for her business

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora María C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de granos básicos el cual comercializa con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos que son su orgullo porque han llegado a ser buenos alumnos en su colegio.

El motivo por el cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar los granos básicos para continuar con sus ventas y para continuar en el desarrollo de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the Terminal Market of the city of Leon, Mrs. Maria C. sells basic grains. She sells these to improve the living conditions of her two young children, who are her pride because they have become such good students at school. Because of this, she is looking for Kiva partner Ceprodel's support by requesting a loan, which she will use to buy basic grains to continue her sales and to continue improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
La señora Apolonia S. se ha destacado por ser comerciante de gaseosas, golosinas y galletas en el mercado La Estación donde atiende en su propio tramo. 

Desde hace 9 años se dedica a laborar en su negocio logrando mejorar su situación debido a que sus inicios fueron muy duros pero ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha financiado para la compra de sus productos para ofertarlos. Hoy en día espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio en su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Apolonia S. has stood out as a salesperson of sodas, candies, and cookies at the Station Market, where she works at her own stand. For nine years, she has worked at her business, improving her situation, which at the beginning was very difficult. She has been able to succeed thanks to the support of Kiva partner Ceprodel, which has financed her to purchase more products to offer her customers. Now she hopes that her loan will be approved to continue her business in this sector.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks (sodas, etc.)

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr:
Né en 1978 dans la préfecture de Vo, Monsieur S. Koami est un menuisier de renommé qui est sollicité par beaucoup de gens et même les entreprises et établissements installés dans le milieu. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il arrive difficilement à satisfaire leurs besoins à cause de ses moyens financiers très limités.
Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients qui ne cessent de le solliciter, il demande un financement pour acheter des bois et des planches dans les grands champs de production, ce qui lui coûterait moins chères. Ceci lui permettra de fabriquer des meubles à vendre et de vite répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Vo Prefecture, Mr. Koami S. is a renowned cabinet-maker who is in demand by many people and even commercial enterprises established in the area. He is married and the father of four children, whose needs he has a difficult time meeting due to very limited financial means. To satisfy his ever-demanding customers better, he is asking for financing to buy wood and planks from the major producer areas, where the prices would be cheaper. This will enable him to make furniture to sell and to meet the demands of his customers quickly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and planks to make and sell furniture

loans.name: Issaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur issaka est un homme marié et âgé de trente quatre ans a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente de friperies au marché local de hedzranawoé, un quartier au centre de Lomé (Togo). Ce monsieur est très motivé dans son commerce. Il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez  WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec quatre (4) ballots de chemise, un (1) ballot de jupe, un (01) ballot de pantalon. 
Il est divorcé de sa femme et réside dans le quartier de kégué, un quartier au centre de Lomé avec ses deux (02) enfants dont il en a la charge.
texts.en:
Mr. K. is a 34-year-old married man who sells second-hand clothing at the local market in Hedzranawoé, an area of central Lomé in Togo. This man is very motivated with his work. He has never taken out a loan with WAGES and is requesting this loan, his first, so he can purchase four bundles of shirts, one bundle of skirts, and one bundle of pants. He is divorced from his wife and resides in the Kégué area of central Lomé with his two children who are under his care.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Natacha

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Kara, Madame S. Natacha vit aujourd’hui dans le village de Djrékpo-Hagou (P/Lacs). Elle est mariée et mère d’une fille. Très dévouée, elle ne cesse de mettre en évidence son esprit d’initiative à travers les activités génératrices de revenus qu’elle exerce. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale et de premières nécessités. Elle a une capacité d’entreprendre et de gérer des activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, le manque de moyens financiers reste son handicap. Elle sollicite un financement pour ouvrir une boutique convenable et agrandir son commerce d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Kara, Ms. Natacha S. currently lives in the village of Djrékpo-Hagou (P/Lacs). She is married and a mother with a daughter. A very devoted woman, she continuously demonstrates her initiative through the income-generating work she does. She sells staple items and groceries and has the ability to take on and manage commercial work. Yet her lack of financial means remains as her handicap. She is requesting financing to open a suitable shop and to expand her commerce in grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with groceries

loans.name: Messavi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur de trente deux ans d’âge est un revendeur de produit d’alimentation générale est un monsieur qui lutte beaucoup pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux des autres membres de sa famille. Il est célibataire et réside dans le quartier de tokoin doumasséssé où il exerce ce commerce. Monsieur K. a déjà obtenu un crédit de chez WAGES qu’il a remboursé régulièrement selon les échéances et sans difficultés. La demande ayant  augmenté surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année, il sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour répondre à la demande avec l’achat de 05 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huiles, 10 cartons de spaghettis et 10 cartons de lait.
texts.en:
This 32-year-old gentleman sells general food products and he struggles a lot to meet not only his own needs, but also those of his family members. He is unmarried and lives in the Tokoin Doumasséssé area where his business is. Mr. K. has already taken out one previous loan with WAGES which he is repaying according to the payment deadlines with no problems. Given that demand has gone up, particularly during the periods of the year-end festivals, he is requesting this loan so he can satisfy his customers’ needs by purchasing five sacks of rice, 10 jugs of oil, 10 cartons of spaghetti, and 10 cartons of milk.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Lina

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame A. Lina est née le 18 Juin 1978 et réside actuellement à Aného où elle exerce ses activités. Coiffeuse de profession, elle n’a pas les moyens suffisants pour ouvrir un atelier pour exercer pleinement son activité. Pour faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants , elle fait la vente de glaçons et d’eau glacée. Cette activité est très rentable surtout en période d’intense chaleur où la demande est très grande. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter un autre congélateur pour une production à grande échelle afin  de pouvoir satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra plus de rentabiliser ses activités et en tirer plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three, Ms. Lina A. was born on June 18, 1978 and currently resides in Aného, where she works. A hairdresser by trade, she lacks sufficient means to open a salon to fulfill her efforts. To address her needs and those of her children, she sells ice cubes and ice water. This business is very profitable, especially during heat waves when the demand is very high. She is requesting financing to buy another freezer for large-scale production in order to satisfy her customers fully. This will enable her to make her business more worthwhile and to derive more revenues from it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer for making and selling ice cubes

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lissette S. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a la venta de derivados del maíz como lo es el refresco de chicha muy común en Nicaragua y en su ciudad de León donde comercializa este producto en el mercado La Estación.

Es importante destacar que la señora S. es madre de dos hijos que debe de mantener sus estudios debido a que es madre soltera. Es por este motivo que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su respectiva comercialización en su establecimiento en el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Lissette S. works very hard selling products derived from corn, such as chicha, a type of cold beverage. Chicha is very common in Nicaragua and in her town of Leon, where she sells it in the La Estacion Market. It is important to point out that Ms. S. is the mother of two children and that she is responsible for their continuing education as she is a single mother. This is why she is looking for support from Kiva partner Ceprodel in order to get a loan to buy the products she sells in the La Estacion Market in the city of Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn to make beverages

loans.name: Akouvi Yanamè

texts.fr:
Madame Akouvi Yamani est âgée de trente huit ans, elle réside dans le quartier d’Agoè, elle exerce dans la restauration, elle a un  bar qu’elle  a nommée « BAR LES EPERVIERS ». Elle est très dynamique et tient son bar depuis 2006 dans le quartier d’agbalepedo un quartier au nord de Lomé (Togo). Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 300000f de chez WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursée et sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de riz, 08 cartons de couscous, 15 cartons de spaghetti et 12 cartons de poissons.
Elle est célibataire et a deux (02) enfants à charge, avec le profit tiré de ce commerce, elle pense bien subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 38 years old and lives in the Agoè region. She is involved in the restaurant trade and has a bar named “Bar Les Éperviers” (Sparrowhawk Bar). She is very dynamic and has operated her bar since 2006 in the Agbalepedo area in northern Lomé in Togo. She has already taken out a loan for 300,000 XOF with WAGES which she repaid in full. She is requesting this second loan so she can buy 15 sacks of rice, eight cartons of couscous, 15 cartons of spaghetti, and 12 cartons of fish. She is unmarried and has two children under her care. With the money she makes from her business, she hopes to be able to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Dédé A.

texts.fr: Madame H.  A. Dédé est née le 05 Mars 1968 à Aného où elle réside actuellement. Mère de deux (2) enfants, elle est couturière de métier. Consciente de la non rentabilité de cette activité, elle a développé le commerce de chaussures et sacs qui l’aident à pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Dynamique et réputée pour la qualité des ses marchandises, elle est plus que sollicitée par ses clients. Devant ses moyens financiers limités, elle est tout le temps confronté à de rupture de stock ce qui réduit ses revenus. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter en gros les chaussures et sacs afin de fidéliser sa clientèle. Ceci l’avantagera beaucoup à relever son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Dédé H. was born on May 5, 1968 in Aného where she currently resides. She is a monther of two children and a dressmaker by trade. Recognizing that her work is unprofitable, she developed a business selling shoes and handbags that helps her to provide for her children. An energetic woman renowned for the quality of her merchandise, she is in extreme demand by her customers. Faced with limited financial means, she is forever confronted with inventory shortages which reduce her revenues. And so, she is requesting financing to buy in bulk some shoes and handbags in order to earn the trust of her customers. This will be in her favor, increasing her standard of living and that of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in handbags and women's shoes

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Madame  Christine T. est née le 05 Novembre 1966 à Aného. Mère de trois (3) enfants, elle vit seule avec ses enfants car son mari l’a abandonnée. Son activité consiste à aller de village en village et parcourir la plage de la ville d’Aného pour acheter des crevettes, crabes et poissons qu’elle fait fumer pour revendre à la frontière Togo - Bénin où elle a beaucoup de clientèle. Dynamique et dévouée, Madame T. n’a plus de moyens financiers pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter plus de crevettes, crabes et poissons. Ceci lui évitera des ruptures de stock et lui permettra d’acquérir d’autres marchés en vue d’accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Christine T. was born November 5, 1966, in Aného. A mother of 3, she lives alone with her children, as her husband left her. Her business consists of going from village to village covering the beach in the city of Aného to buy shrimp, crab, and fish, which she smokes to sell at the Togo-Bénin border, where she has a lot of customers. Energetic and devoted, Mrs. T. has no more financial means to satisfy her clientele. She seeks a loan to buy more shrimp, crab, and fish. This will prevent her from running out of stock and will allow her to gain other markets in order to increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To smoke and sell fish, shrimp, and crab

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame L. Kayi est née le 28 Mai 1972 à Aného où elle réside actuellement. Son mari est électricien mais n’a plus de travail ce qui fait que toutes les charges se reposent sur Madame L.. Déterminée à garantir un avenir meilleur à ses progénitures, elle se bat jour et nuit en vendant des jus de fruits et de l’eau glacée. N’ayant pas les moyens suffisants, elle sollicite un financement pour s’acheter un congélateur, des glacières nécessaires pour accroître sa production.
texts.en:
A married mother of 3, Mrs. Kayi L. was born May 28, 1972, in Aného, where she currently lives. Her husband is an electrician but no longer has a job, which makes all the responsibility fall on Mrs. L.. Determined to guarantee a better life for her offspring, she struggles day and night selling fruit juice and iced water. Not having enough means, she seeks a loan to buy a freezer and ice boxes needed to increase her production.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a freezer and ice boxes to make and sell ice and fruit juice

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Marcia Argentina M. originaria de la ciudad de León se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa usada en el mercado la Estación iniciando su actividad desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana todos los días hasta el atardecer.

Atiende a sus clientes en su propio establecimiento donde ofrece todo tipo de ropa como lo es camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de la ropa para comercializarla es por esta razón que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcia Argentina Martinez, native of the city of Leon, works selling used clothes in the La Estacion Market. She works each day from early in the morning until dusk. She serves clients in her own establishment, where she offers a variety of clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses, etc. She has now come to Kiva partner Ceprodel for a loan which will allow her to buy clothing for resale, and she hopes this loan will be granted so that she can continue her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Comlanvi

texts.fr: Né le 27 Avril 1965 à Aného, Monsieur S. Comlanvi est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Electricien de formation, il a fini par abandonner ce métier au profit du maraîchage. C’est une activité très rentable et qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers. Aujourd’hui, il a besoin d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et accroître ses revenus. Il sollicite un financement pour acheter des engrais et fertilisants. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born April 27, 1965, in Aného, Mr. Comlanvi S. is a married father of 3. An electrician by training, he left this trade in favor of truck farming. It’s a very profitable business, which requires significant financial means. Today he needs to expand his cultivatable land and increase his revenues. He seeks a loan to buy plant food and fertilizer. This will allow him to increase his production and better satisfy his clientele.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his cultivatable land and to buy farming materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his buisiness

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es:
Hugo Alberto y su esposa tienen dos hijos y están en edad escolar, ellos viven al poniente de la ciudad, este fraccionamiento es uno de los más poblados y por lo tanto la inseguridad se hace presente.
Una de las más urgentes necesidades de la familia es proteger su patrimonio. Para ello hay que construir una barda e instalar un portón.
Solicita un préstamo para poder llevar acabo su proyecto y mantener la tranquilidad de su hogar, pues cada vez que salen es una preocupación y no saben si encontrarán todo igual.
En el momento de la visita no se encontraba el Sr. Hugo, estaba trabajando; por tal motivo sale su esposa y su hija.
texts.en:
Hugo Alberto and his wife have two school-age children and live in the west end of the city, one of the most densely populated and therefore unsafe areas. One of the most important concerns for his family is the protection of their assets. To do so they must build a fence and a gate. Hugo Alberto is asking for a loan to undertake this project and maintain the peace of his home, as every time they leave they worry that they will not find things as they left them. At the time of the visit to take the photograph Mr. Hugo was at work, so his wife and daughter came out instead.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence and gate

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis G. prácticamente está empezando una nueva etapa de su vida, su esposa y su pequeño hijo lo motivan a continuar adelante; trabaja en una maquiladora como operario y comenta que quiere seguir prosperando. Este es su único ingreso. 
Su vivienda requiere de mejoras y en este momento la primordial son las bardas perimetrales. Para que su hijo pueda jugar en el patio sin el riesgo de que salga a la calle.
De la misma manera desea que su familia esté segura cuando él no está en casa, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Jose Luis G. is just beginning a new stage of his life, his wife and his young son are motivating him to move forward. He works in a factory as an operator and says he wants to keep doing well. This is his only income. His house needs repairs and at this moment the construction of a fence is of the utmost importance. This would allow his son to play on the patio without the risk of going out into the street. As well it would keep his family safe when he is not at home, which is why he is asking for a loan in order to make these improvements as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence

loans.name: Eva Bibiana

texts.es:
La señora Eva ha sacado adelante a sus cinco hijos con mucho esfuerzo y trabajando duro, ella es un claro ejemplo de una luchadora de la vida.
Ella trabaja como empleada domestica y con sus ingresos hace milagros para vestir, alimentar y darles educación a sus hijos.
Y por si fuera poco, ha podido ahorrar para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto para sus hijos, Doña Eva requiere de su apoyo para lograr sus metas, en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para terminar. Estará sumamente agradecida por su contribución.
texts.en:
Eva has brought up her five children with a lot of effort and hard work, she is a real survivor. She works as a maid and does miracles with her income to dress, feed, and educate her children. If that wasn't enough, she has been saving in order to build a room for her children but needs your help to complete this project, at the moment she doesn't have the funds to finish the job. She will be extremely grateful for your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completion of interior renovations

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina G. con gran entusiasmo en su negocio de venta de ropa usada, todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana abre su establecimiento en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde es visitada por los clientes vendiendo la ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

Actualmente ella atraviesa una necesidad y es que requiere comprar la ropa para su respectiva comercialización y es por esta razón que ella ha buscado el apoyo incondicional en Ceprodel el cual le brinda financiamiento por medio de los créditos. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente en su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Early every morning Luz Marina G. enthusiastically opens her used clothing business at the La Terminal market in León. Customers go to her to buy clothing for women, men, and children. She currently needs to buy clothing for her business, and to do that she seeks Ceprodel's wholehearted support since they offer financing through loans. Her clothing business will benefit greatly from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena M. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de alimentos y refrescos en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León.

Con mucho esfuerzo ella se dedica a su labor con el propósito de honrar su compromiso de mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar. 

Hoy en día al necesitar los ingredientes para elaborar los alimentos, ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito para la compra de dichos ingredientes de la comida y de los refrescos para su respectiva venta en su localidad
texts.en:
Elena M.'s work involves selling food and drink in León's La Terminal market. She puts a lot of effort into her work so that she can honor her committment to take care of her two small, school-aged children. Right now she needs ingredients to make her foods. She has approached Ceprodel for a loan so that she can buy ingredients for the food and beverages that she will then sell at her place.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Neris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Neris B. es una dama cuya labor es la venta de verduras ubicada en el sector de verduras en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes.

El negocio lo inició desde hace 12 años habiendo obtenido los primeros productos gracias a sus propios ahorros que ella hacía anteriormente y hoy en día ha logrado mejorar dicho negocio . La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de las verduras para luego venderlas en su establecimiento en el mercado La Terminal
texts.en:
Neris B. works selling vegetables in the produce section of León's La Terminal market, where she attentively serves her customers. She started the business 12 years ago, having purchased the first products with her own prior savings. Today she has improved that business. Through Ceprodel she hopes to get a loan to buy vegetables that she can later sell from her business in the La Terminal market.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia del Carmen se ha destacado como comerciante de ropa atendiendo su establecimiento en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León. Con mucho ahínco, como toda mujer nicaragüense se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y por llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. 

El motivo único por el cual ella ha solicitado el préstamo en Ceprodel es para la compra de la ropa con el objetivo de llenar sus estantes ofreciendo mayor variedad a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en el mercado donde se desempeña.
texts.en:
Ofelia del Carmen has excelled as a clothing merchant overseeing her business in León's La Terminal market. Like all Nicaraguan women she is known as an eager, hard worker, and she provides for her home. Her only reason for applying for the Ceprodel loan is to buy clothing to fill her shelves, offering a wider variety to her customers who visit her daily in the market where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Juana Vilma se ha destacado en el Mercado La Terminal por sus ventas de productos como prensadores, colas, chapas, cosméticos entre otros.

Se dedica a vender estos productos desde el año 1993 y este ha sido su único ingreso con el que mantiene su hogar supliendo las necesidades que en él se presentan. Por ser madre soltera ella ha sido la única que ha llevado el sustento a su hogar y para esto se ha apoyado de las ventas obtenidas de sus productos gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos. Una vez más espera que le sea entregado su crédito para continuar con su negocio que tanto necesita de inversión.
texts.en:
Juana Vilma has excelled at La Terminal market by selling pins, hair ties, decorative buttons, and cosmetics, among other things. She has been selling these products since 1993, and it has been the only source of income for maintaining her home and meeting needs as they arise. Since she is a single mother she has been the only one providing for her home. Her merchandise sales have helped her, thanks to Ceprodel's support in purchasing those products. Once more she hopes Ceprodel will grant her loan so that she can continue her business, which very much needs investment.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda M. R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casada esta Señora tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de ella su hija mayor tiene la edad 19 años y cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria, su hijo de 13 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria y su hija de 3 años cursa el 2 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como agricultor, en sus deseos esta obtener mas activo su negocio ya que la situación actual en la que el país se encuentra en una situación  muy difícil de sobrellevar, además en sus propósitos esta seguirle aportando ayuda a sus hijos ya que ellos necesitan tener un futuro lleno de estudios para que día de mañana puedan defenderse por si solos.

Su  actividad económica es una pulpería en la que vende los productos tales como: golosinas, granos básicos, hielo, bolsita, refrescos, pollo y licor, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación con la siguiente dirección colegio pureza de Maria 100 varas arriba, ella inicia este negocio por no tener un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos para ella y su familia y decide implementar la venta de bolsitas y granos básicos al comienzo no vendía mucho estos productos razón por la que decide incrementar mas su negocio y decide colocar otro negocio de videojuegos y  surtir su pulpería con mas producto y así obtiene su propio lugar de trabajo siendo este el que le proporcione ingresos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de controles para los videojuegos y para su pulpería ya que tiene que ofrecer a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Yolanda M. R. is 49 years old, married, and has 7 children, 3 of whom depend on her. Her oldest daughter is 19 years old and she is in her 5th year of secondary school. Her son of 13 years is in 6th grade of primary school. Her 3 year old daughter is in 2nd grade of primary school. Her husband works as a farmer. Yolanda wishes to make her business more active, because the difficult situation in her country is hard to endure. Furthermore, she wants to continue to contribute help to her children, because they need to have a future that is full of studies, so that in the future they may survive on their own. Yolanda’s economic activity is a local store in which she sells products like candy, basic grains, ice, soft drinks, chicken, and liquor. Her business is located in her house that is located on Colegio Pureza de Maria 100 Varas Arriba. Yolanda started her business because she didn’t have a stable job as a source of income for her and her family, so she decided to begin the sale of shopping bags and basic grains. In the beginning, she didn’t sell a lot of these products, and so she decided to increase the size of her business and decided to invest in another business of video games and to stock up her store with more products. It is this way that she secured her own workplace that functions as her source of income for her family. This loan is to be used to buy controls for the videogames that she sells, and for her store, because she has to offer a large variety of products to her clients

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy video game controllers and to stock her store.

loans.name: Felipa Consuelo

texts.es:
Felipa R. se ha destacado en el trabajo de la venta de productos de uso personal el cual ha logrado comercializar en su pequeño establecimiento en el Mercado La Terminal de León. Entre los productos que ella ofrece se encuentran colas, pirañas, limas de uñas, pinturas de labios, entre otras.

Actualmente el negocio de la señora Felipa requiere de inversión en estos productos y para esto ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la adquisición de los productos para su respectiva comercialización. Con este crédito logrará mejorar sus ventas y podrá continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
Felipa R. has concentrated on the sale of products for personal use, that she has been able to commercialize in her small establishment in the market “La Terminal de León.” Among the products that she offers are nail files and lipstick. Felipa’s business requires the investment in such products and for this she has come to Ceprodel to be helped with a loan that would allow her to acquire the products for her respective business. With this loan she seeks to better her sales and will be able to continue bringing support to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Olga Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Olga Lorena T. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella su hijo mayor de 27 años de edad y es labora de contador y su otro hijo de 20 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de la carrera de administración de empresas, su propósitos son de aumentar su negocio además desea seguir ayudando a sus hijos y dejarle a ellos un futuro en el negocio  para que el día de mañana pueda mantenerse por si solos y en sus deseos esta darle a sus hijos su propia casa para que vivan tranquilos y tengan un lugar propio.

Su actividad económica es venta de comida el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado de subtiava, ella da inicio a este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y es entonces que implementa el negocio de venta de comida y comienza con huevos y gallo pinto mas tarde los diferentes clientes le pedían otro tipo de comidas y es así que decide implementar su negocio y obtiene un lugar donde ofrecer su venta, por lo que solicita financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de los granos básicos para suministro de su trabajo ya que ella lucho mucho para conseguir un trabajo y este le ha proporcionado la ayuda necesaria para salir adelante agradece siempre trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Olga Lorena T. is 47 years old, single, and has four children, of which two depend on her. Her oldest son of 27 is an accountant. Her son of 20 years is in currently in his second year of venture administration. Olga’s intention is to increase her business. Furthermore, she wishes to continue helping her children and to leave them a future in the business so that in the future they will be able to maintain themselves. She also hopes to give her children their own house so that they may live peacefully and have their own place. Her economic activity is the sale of food. She has had her business for 12 years, and it is located in the market of Subtiava. She started her business because she needed to move forward. She began with the sale of eggs and gallo pinto (a national dish). Later on, different clients asked for different types of food and for this reason she decided to implement her own business and to obtain a place where she could offer her sale. It is for this reason that she is asking for this loan that will be used as capital to buy basic grains for her business’s supply since she struggles a great deal to secure a job. In this pursuit she has supplied herself with the necessary help to move forward, always grateful to work with the Fundación León 2000, and their friend-organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena R. se dedica a la venta de productos personales como lo son colas, chapas, pulseras, peluches y cosméticos en el mercado La Terminal de León donde ofrece sus productos a los clientes que a diario le visitan

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de estos productos debido a que las ventas han estado muy buenas y al habérsele agotado la mercadería le urge comprar nuevamente los productos y es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena R. sells personal products like pogs, bracelets, plushy toys, and cosmetics in the market La Terminal de León where she offers her products to her clients that visit her daily. Today she is asking for a loan through Ceprodel to buy these products given that sales have been very good and after having sold out the market she urgently needs to buy new products. It is for this reason that she that her loan will be granted and through this she will be able to continue business that needs your support very much.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Maria Auxiliadora S. B. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta señora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de ella su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 23 años de edad y labora como albañil, su otra hija de 20 años trabaja ayudándole a su mama y su otra hija de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de aumentar sus productos para así mantener su negocio, en sus deseos esta proporcionarle mejoras a su casa de habitación ya que necesita realizarle las respectivas mejoras para que sus hijos puedan tener un porvenir para el día de mañana.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa como: pantalones para dama y para caballero, ropa interior para hombres, tobilleras y blusas para damas, la ubicación de su negocio es en honduras, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 24 años, Doña Maria inicia con el negocio de planchado y lavado por encargo y de lo que obtenía de ganancia de este trabajo es lo que invierte para su nuevo negocio y una amiga quien era la que tenia conocimiento de este tipo de negocio empieza con 4 docenas de pantalones y mas tarde consigue obtener mas clientes por lo que necesita satisfacer a sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo razón por la que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos como mochilas, pantalones para damas y caballeros ya que necesita realizar el viaje hasta honduras en donde le resulta mas factible la compra de estos productos.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora S. B. is 44 years old, is single, and has 5 children, 3 of whom depend on her. Her oldest son is 23 years old and is a construction worker. One of her daughters is 20 years old and works helping her mother, and her other daughter of 16 is currently in her 5th year of secondary school. Marias intends to increase her stocks so that she may maintain her business. She wishes to supply improvements to her home, so that her children may have a future. Her economic activity is the sale of clothing like, men’s and women’s pants, underwear for men, ankle supports and blouses for women. Her business is located in Honduras, and she has had it for the 24 years. Maria started with the business of washing and ironing for charge and with the money she made from this business, she invested in her new business. A friend of hers who had known about the clothing business started her off with 4 dozen pairs of pants, and later on she gained more and more clients. It is because she needs to satisfy these clients that the loan she is asking for will be used to buy products like backpacks and women’s and men’s pants, for which she will need to travel to Honduras in which it will be more feasible to acquire such products.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es un negocio que constantemente requiere inversión por lo que los clientes buscan variedades y estilos y por este motivo la señora Maribel R. ha buscado la manera de surtir su negocio mejorándolo cada día para mantener su clientela y evitar que se vayan a otra tienda.

Su negocio está ubicado en el sector de las ropas en el mercado La Terminal de León y acá atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente. La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de la ropa para exhibirla y venderla en su negocio que tanto necesita de inversión en este momento.
texts.en:
The sale of clothing is a business that constantly requires reinvestment because clients look for varieties and specific styles, and for this reason Maribel Rodriguez has looked for a means to supply her business, bettering it each day so that she can maintain her clientele and prevent them from shopping at other stores. Her business is located in the clothing sector in the market La Terminal de León and there she assists her clients nicely. The reason that she has come to Ceprodel is to ask for a loan that will allow her to buy clothing to show and sell in her business, that truly needs a reinvestment of capital at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Esta emprendedora Señora de nombre Cecilia Del Rosario Martínez tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es casada, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella es una niña de 15 años de edad que cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su esposo labora como conductor, sus deseos son de ayudar a su hija para que ella pueda salir adelante en sus estudios debido a lo difícil que es en el país coronar una carrera, en sus propósitos esta mantener su negocio activo y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que este seria uno de los propósitos que le gustaría cumplir debido a la temporada de invierno su casa tiene problemas y sus motivos a realizarle las mejoras son mas fuertes.

Su actividad económica es la de  venta de comida: arroz, frijoles, carne desmenuzada, bistec y vigoron, su negocio esta ubicado en la entrada del Ingenio San Antonio en chichigalpa, ella tiene de poseer este negocio 20 años, sus comienzos se dan por cuenta propia ya que siempre la ha gustado mantenerse trabajando y decide poner una venta de frutas, leche y cuajada al notar la poca afluencia de clientes decide llevar a cabo una idea que seria la venta de comida en la empresa del Ingenio por lo que decide conseguir el permiso para  la venta de comida en este lugar, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar los granos básicos ya que cada día el precio de la comida es cada ves mas alto y los producto que desea comprar son arroz, azúcar y aceite ya que de esta modo le resultaría mas factible.
texts.en:
This entrepeneur's name is Cecilia Del Rosario M.. She is 44 years old and married with 6 children, only one of whom is still at home, a 15-year girl in her 3rd year of high school. Her husband works as a driver. Her hope is to help her daughter get a good education because it's difficult to get work in her country without one. She's applying for a loan to maintain her business and make improvements to her house because the house needs repairs, something more urgent now that winter is approaching.

Cecilia operates a food business selling rice, beans, shredded meat, and steak. Her business is located at the entrance of Ingenio San Antonio in Chichigalpa. She has owned the business for 20 years. She noticed that her customers had little money so she started by selling fruit, milk and curds. She also decided that it would be a good idea to sell food at the office of the Ingenio San Antonio so she got permission to sell there. The loan is for working capital that she will use to buy basic products because food prices are climbing day by day. The products that she wants to buy are rice, sugar and cooking oil because those are the most profitable products for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irma Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Irma O. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote dedicándose a su negocio de pulpería donde vende sus productos en su propia casa de habitación. Se ha destacado como una persona muy esforzada que tiene grandes deseos de superación en su negocio. 

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por la razón de que ha logrado beneficiarla con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos y también ha logrado comprar una vitrina para colocar dichos productos. 

La razón por la cual ella ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel es para obtener el financiamiento para la compra de los productos y así comercializarlos en su pulpería que necesita de mucha inversión.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma O. is originally from Nagarote and she has a small general store in her home. She is known as a strong person with great desire to have her business be successful. Ceprodel has been a pillar for her business because of the loans it provided in order to buy products and also to be able to buy a display case to display said products, benefiting her business. The reason she has asked Ceprodel for a loan is to obtain financing to buy products to sell in her store, which requires an investment of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum D. is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. He is married to Heng Seang, age 31, a rice farmer. They have two children, all of whom are single. Mr. D. has been a local fisherman since 2000. He uses nets and traps from his fishing boat to catch fish in Tunle Sap Lake. Mr. D. is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing supplies for his business that will allow him to catch more fish. (Mr. D.'s wife is pictured because he was not available.)

loans.use: Purchase more fishing supplies

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is happily living in Barangay Minallo, Naguillan, which is a small village located two kilometers away from the Provincial Highway of Isabela. She is married to Ely Bert, a farmer and they have a four year old son named John Carlo.
Rowena has a small village store which sells prime commodities. “My limited income from our store encouraged me to engage in poultry and backyard piggery which I think I will earn more income,” Rowena said.
She is requesting an additional working capital to expand her poultry and piggery. She needs PHP 5,000 to purchase a piglet and 20 chicks which are available in the local public market. The remaining amount will be used to buy feed for her livestock and additional stocks for her store such as cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, noodles, coffee and other cooking ingredients.
She dreams to have a mini grocery someday in preparation for the future education of their only son.

loans.use: buy piglet, chicks, animal feeds and additional stocks for her store

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie has been managing a small store in their village since 2001. She is married to Teofilo who owns a passenger tricycle. They have two children aged six and seven who are currently in school.

Her income from her store is still inadequate to support the family's daily expenses so she would like a loan amounting to Php 5,000 to buy additional products like rice, cooking oil, noodles, and canned goods for her store. By adding more items in her store she will help provide for the family's daily needs and saving for the education of their children.  She also dreams that her store will become a grocery store someday.
	
She said that “God has mercy to those who work hard for their future” which is why Lailanie and her husband are both working hard for their family’s future.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mr. So S. is 73 years old , and his wife, Oun Noeun, is 62. They are residents in Kompong Tom Province. Mr. S. is a father of six children, four of whom are married and living away from home, and two are employed. The son is a fisherman, and the daughter is a garment worker at Phnom Penh Town.

Mr. S. and his wife have been farmers since 1979. They own farmland in their village, where they grow rice and vegetables. To alleviate the hard work of farming, Mr. S. has requested a loan to purchase oxen to help him plow the fields and a cart to transport his crops.

loans.use: Purchase oxen and a cart

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Virginia is married to Rudy Sr. and are blessed with five kids. They live in the small rural area of Brgy. San Pedro Tumauini, Isabela.

For almost 21 years, Virginia’s second home is the Tumauini Public Market where she has a stall for grinding and selling coconut, sugar and rice which are used in making native cakes and other native delicacies. 
 
Virginia works hard to support the education of her two children who are still studying in school. She would like an additional loan of PHP20,000 to buy more coconut, charcoal, brown sugar, plastic bags and other merchandise which she will sell in her stall. She expects to have more income with the increase in output after selling these products. It will help her to save for the education of her children and also in maintaining her business. 

Virginia considers perseverance, hard work, and loving the customers will result to better operation of her business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
“ I dreamed of having a bigger store in order to provide for all my family needs”, says Rosalinda A., 48-year old mother of two children from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She wants a good life for her children and she is doing her best to gradually realize all her dreams.

She is into retail business. She started putting up a mini-store last December 15, 2004 from her small savings and joined CEVI to finance her business.

She would like to purchase additional supplies for her store to increase her sales. She is also looking into some other income generating activities to support her family.

“CEVI has created a lasting impact on the people”, she said. “Through its credit program, everyone has the chance to have credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage”, she added.
